Job Title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst - Cary, NC
Job Description:
Hiring a BCBA to join our growing team in Cary, NC!
Generous Sign-On Bonus and Relocation Package!

We are currently seeking highly skilled and dedicated Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBA) to join our team in Cary, NC. As a BCBA, you will be responsible for providing comprehensive behavior analysis services to individuals with autism spectrum disorders and other developmental disabilities. You will work closely with clients, families, and a multidisciplinary team to develop and implement individualized behavior plans, conduct assessments, and provide ongoing behavior analysis therapy.

Patterns Behavioral Services, Inc. - Identifying Patterns, Changing Trajectories
Benefits

Competitive pay based on tenure as a BCBA and experience
Generous Relocation Package and Sign-On Bonus up to $15,000
Support from a team of clinicians with over 20 years of experience
FREE continuing education units
Health insurance (Medical, Dental, and Vision)
401K plan
Paid Vacation and Sick Time Off
Paid Holidays
Mileage reimbursement and Paid Drive Time
Fingerprinting reimbursement
Flexible schedules
Professional growth and career development opportunities
Access to National University with 15% discounted rates towards coursework
Access to Purdue University Global with 20% off published tuition rates for all undergraduate programs and certificates, 14% off published tuition rates for all graduate programs and certificates
Employee Assistance Program (EAP) (available to all employees)
Generous Employee Referral Program

At Patterns build a nationwide community of compassionate individuals for one purpose; to serve others selflessly. Children and adults with behavioral needs deserve empathetic and functional ABA support from dedicated professionals. Patterns is a center-based, in-home, and school provider of behavioral services to families with children diagnosed with ASD and other developmental disabilities. We are currently expanding our services and are looking for career-minded, experienced ABA Superheroes to join our team. At Patterns, you will find a professional, ethical, structured, respectful, caring, and fun work environment where you can reach your career goals! Together, we are Patterns, a team like no other. We aim to be different. Service and Integrity of our clients is our utmost concern and priority. We maintain a culture of relentless optimism as we do what we've been called to do.

YOUR VALUED ROLE

Conduct functional behavior assessments to identify target behaviors and develop appropriate treatment plans.
Collaborate with families, caregivers, and other professionals to gather information, set goals, and develop behavior intervention plans.
Implement behavior analytic strategies and interventions to address behavioral challenges and improve functional skills.
Provide direct behavior analysis therapy to individuals, both in clinical settings and in natural environments.
Collect and analyze data to evaluate treatment effectiveness and make necessary adjustments to behavior plans.
Train and supervise behavior technicians and other team members in implementing behavior intervention strategies.
Maintain accurate and detailed records of client progress, behavior plans, and treatment outcomes.
Stay current with the latest research and developments in the field of behavior analysis and autism treatment.

Requirements

Master's degree in Applied Behavior Analysis, Psychology, or a related field.
Current Board Certification as a Behavior Analyst (BCBA) from the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB).
Experience working with individuals with autism spectrum disorders and other developmental disabilities.
Strong knowledge of behavior analysis principles and techniques, including functional behavior assessment and behavior intervention plan development.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to collaborate effectively with clients, families, and team members.
Ability to work independently, demonstrate problem-solving skills, and make clinical decisions based on data analysis.
Proficient in using data collection software and technology for behavior analysis.

Company Name: Elite Healthcare Group of Winston Salem
Job Description:
About us

Welcome to Elite Healthcare Group Greensboro. Where everything you will do is helping provide the best possible outcomes for our patients! We are dedicated to evidence-based interventions, such as Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA), and continually strive to be a leader in the development of the field. We pride ourselves on keeping up to date on proven research that could impact our family's intervention.

Our work environment includes:

Modern office setting
Work-from-home days
Growth opportunities
Food provided

Our company is looking for Board Certified Behavior Analysts with experience working in the pediatric field. The successful candidates will have a deep understanding of behavior analysis and be able to make valuable contributions to our growing team. We are specifically interested in individuals that can improve the efficiency of our current analytical techniques. The candidate must have clinical experience working with children and as part of a team, be able to work well under stress, and have excellent communication skills.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Master’s degree in Special Education or related human services field;
Successful completion of internship and/or formal training in the analysis of behavior and instructional strategies training related to working with clients who have pervasive developmental disorders and related disorders, their parents, and other agencies working with client
Ability to demonstrate competence in behavior management skill, instructional skills, oral and written communication, organizational skills and interpersonal relations
Ability to work with a variety of clients in regard to age, functionality, and with minimal direction
Knowledge of DTT programming and implementation
Knowledge of Word, Excel and Outlook systems
Ability to utilize a fax machine, phone system, and other office materials as necessary for the position
Ability to respond quickly to phone calls, text messages, and emails

RESPONSIBILIITES:

Function in a supervisory capacity and provide oversight to all areas of programming including the training of direct support professionals, person centered strategies consultants (if applicable) and DSP trainers.
Assist in the development, facilitation, and follow-up training in Applied Behavior Analysis, using both discrete trial training and natural environment training models of teaching.
Facilitate and assist in the development and identification of resources and support information for clients and their families
Provide model teaching and other direct instructional supports including, but not limited to, practicum supervision/teaching, class instruction and in-service instruction to other support professionals.
Assist in the development and implementation of assessment tools, to conduct functional assessments and analyses when appropriate, and to develop appropriate behavior strategies to teach appropriate behavior and reduce maladaptive behaviors.
Provide ongoing support and training to direct support professionals, ABA implementers, and other individuals in support roles for families.
Ongoing training and supervision of paraprofessional staff in implementation of ABA principles and methodology and behavior reduction strategies.
Create ongoing data collection system to establish baseline and programmatic efficacy for all consumers, and to analyze data on a frequent and ongoing basis to guide programming.
Develop behavior plans/treatment plans for all consumers with a focus on teaching and other antecedent strategies for reducing problematic behavior(s).
Meet as needed with supervised staff to discuss ongoing consumer issues and to provide support when necessary.
Review and sign off on behavior plan/treatment plan training for all field staff and provide field supervision when necessary.
Utilize Set Works website to enter session notes within 24 hours of each session.
Provide consultation services and to maintain ongoing communication with all constituents (other supports, parents, community, and community agencies).
Keep current with the literature, new research findings and resources. In addition, continuing education courses to maintain BCBA certification are necessary (32 credits every 2 years).
Maintain all data, paperwork, and communication between personal care staff and families, and to provide ongoing feedback to government related agencies that contract with such families.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Job Title: Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst (BCaBA) or QASP-S
Job Description:
Basic Function

Responsible for clinical, supervisory, and case management activities related to the delivery of behavior analytic services to children with an ASD diagnosis and their family, under supervision of Licensed or Certified Behavior Analyst. Assistant Behavior Analysts provide support to individuals and their families by coordinating services that are conceptually consistent with the behavioral principles and utilizes evidenced-based practices. With oversight from Behavior Analyst, the Assistant Behavior Analyst will also provide ongoing support, training, and supervision to direct service providers (behavior technicians (BT), Registered Behavior Technicians (RBT), Applied Behavior Analysis Technicians (ABATs).

Responsibilities

Design and oversee individualized Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) treatment programs for assigned clients and submit for approval by Behavior Analyst.
Document behavioral assessments and treatment plan recommendations in writing in a timely manner, using company resources and participate in peer review processes for quality assurance.
Use data collection systems to establish baseline and assess intervention efficacy of client’s treatment programs. Analyze data, to include graphic depictions of progress, on a frequent and ongoing basis to guide necessary treatment plan modifications.
Conduce face-to-face clinical oversight of the delivery of ABA services to clients for the purpose of evaluating efficacy of treatment, technicians’ treatment integrity or adherence to instructional protocols, and evaluation of interobserver agreement.
Train behavior technicians, parents, family members, and other professionals to implement individualized ABA treatment plans and behavior intervention techniques
Supervise behavioral technicians with clients and provide immediate feedback and direction in correct implementation of ABA intervention strategies specified in authorized treatment plan.
Monitor the administration of ABA programs for individual clients at all locations at which services are provided.
Conduct monthly family guidance / family training services
Participate in coordination of care activities that serve the best interest of the client
Ensure client appointments are added to the practice management platform prior to rendering of services and converted, with clinical documentation completed within 24 hours of service.
Provide supervision of behavioral staff in accordance with certifying board requirements (e.g. no less than 5% per month, maintaining record of supervisory contacts, and documenting non-client facing meetings that are behavioral-analytic in nature).
Provide direct services with clients while implementing behavioral programs or probing skill deficit areas
Ensure all behavior analytic service hours are tracked monthly and attend 1:1 meetings with Behavior Analyst to meet minimum supervision requirements, completing all necessary documentation for compliance with board policies.
Attend clinical and operational meetings as assigned.
Adhere to company and professional standards, to include licensing board or certifying board’s code of ethics.
Travel to sites as assigned.
Perform related duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

Education and Experience:

Any combination of training, experience, and/or education equivalent to graduation from an accredited college or university with a bachelor’s degree in a related field such as psychology, speech/language pathology or behavior analysis and three years experience providing ABA and/or 2 years’ supervisory experience using ABA strategies with clients with autism. Extensive training and experience in child development and Applied Behavior Analysis, with an emphasis in discrete trial training is required.

Licenses and Other Requirements

Current BACB, QABA, or State License/Certification as Assistant Behavior Analyst and requisite degrees are required, unless other criteria are met based upon BACB guidelines that pre-date the current BCBA/QBA standards.

Job Title: Business Analyst - Inventory and Pricing
Location: Asheboro, NC

Job Type: Full-Time

About Us:

T&M Apparel is a dynamic and innovative company that specializes in medical uniform apparel. We are committed to delivering exceptional products and services to our customers. We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Business Analyst - Inventory and Pricing Specialist to join our team. If you are passionate about data analysis, inventory management, pricing strategies, forecasting, and planning, we want you to be a part of our growing company.

Job Description:
As a Business Analyst - Inventory and Pricing Specialist at T&M Apparel, you will play a crucial role in ensuring our company's success through the effective analysis and management of inventory, pricing strategies, forecasting, and planning. You will be responsible for:

Responsibilities:

1. Analysis & Reporting:

Collect, analyze, and interpret data to provide valuable insights for decision-making.
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to track inventory and pricing performance.
Present findings and recommendations to senior management to support strategic initiatives.

2. Inventory Management:

Oversee inventory levels, including procurement, allocation, and demand planning.
Optimize inventory turnover while minimizing holding costs.
Implement best practices for stock control and accuracy.

3. Pricing:

Develop, implement, and monitor pricing strategies to maximize profitability.
Analyze market trends, competitive pricing, and customer behavior to make informed pricing decisions.
Regularly review and adjust pricing models to maintain competitiveness.

4. Forecasting:

Utilize historical data, market trends, and other factors to create accurate demand forecasts.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure product availability meets customer demand.
Continuously improve forecasting models and methodologies.

5. Planning:

Collaborate with the planning team to align inventory and pricing strategies with overall business goals.
Assist in creating and maintaining a detailed inventory and pricing plan.
Identify potential risks and opportunities and develop contingency plans.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Supply Chain Management, or a related field
Proven experience in inventory management, pricing strategies, forecasting, and planning.
Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis tools and software. Specifically Microsoft Excel
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Attention to detail and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Knowledge of industry-specific software and tools is a plus.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.

Benefits:

Competitive salary and bonus structure.
Opportunity for professional development and growth.
Collaborative and inclusive work environment.
Chance to make a significant impact on the company's success.

If you are a dedicated and results-driven individual with a passion for data analysis and a keen understanding of inventory management and pricing strategies, we encourage you to apply for the Business Analyst - Inventory and Pricing Specialist position at T&M Apparel. Join our team and be part of our exciting journey to success.

How to Apply:

Please send your resume and a cover letter outlining your qualifications and interest in the position using the tools on Indeed. We look forward to reviewing your application and potentially welcoming you to our team.

JOB SUMMARY

The Senior Business Data Analyst provides strategic and tactical support to the enterprise by analyzing and interpreting data for solutions. Develops rules and methodologies for effective Data Management. Uses knowledge of data analysis tools and other technology to provide data integration solutions. They are responsible for the development of an in-depth understanding and analysis of the data requirements for projects and ad-hoc reporting and analysis needs. This position influences senior management, technical leads and architects in achieving strategic goals by facilitating the data availability and quality of systems and processes. Provides technical and professional assistance for less experienced team members.




RESPONSIBILITIES


Competencies:
Responsible for both leading and participating in a team of analysts focused on the analysis, design, implementation, and follow up of the migration of data from the on-premises Enterprise Data Warehouse to the Azure Data Warehouse.
Leads and directs the work of others.
Lead research, planning, development and testing of data provisioning, analysis and ad-hoc reporting solutions.
Participates in developing the methodology for documenting data templates for various types of data.
The ability to extract and analyze data, patterns, and related trends, with the subsequent ability to synthesize the data into information consumable by senior business decisionmakers.
Reviews and ensures that major data architectural designs are consistent, maintainable, flexible and cost effective.
Understands industry trends, emerging technologies and standards in order to evolve the Standards and Roadmap.
Provides analysis to support development of vision, data strategy, data architecture and the overall design and development of Enterprise Data Warehouse as needed.
Provides consultation to application owners, business partners and peer groups regarding long and short-range data solutions that meet business requirements.
Diagnoses data problems effectively and determines solution options with consideration to business impact.
Adheres to enterprise architecture strategies, principals, standards, policies and procedures. Understands and ensures compliance with IT strategy.
Diagnose and fix bugs, performance and security issues
Be a champion of digital security at TTX
Ensure resources diagnose and fix bugs, performance and security issues
Document system architecture o Improve the overall quality and security of any related systems
Ensure access to data follows the principle of least privilege as required


Professional:

QUALIFICATIONS


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent and work experience defined as 7 or more years of overall experience with data analysis for major software systems.
Excellent knowledge of data requirements for the Railroad Industry.

Excellent interpersonal and communications skills - lead, collaborate, facilitate, and negotiate as necessary.

SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES: This class is responsible for numerous functions and activities enterprise- wide that are tied to process creation, optimization and ultimately developing solution designs that lead to more effective and efficient operations. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, leading and supporting efforts across all divisions and departments to: examine processes holistically to understand the impact of changing them on people, strategy, systems, and general business operations; identifying solutions that will enhance processes and associated work flows; creating detailed documentation for critical processes that support business, technical, and disaster recovery requirements; leading organizational change management initiatives to minimize employee resistance and maximize employee engagement, to include design and implementation of a structured methodology, development and management of communications, conducting impact analysis to assess change readiness, and leading training efforts; working with others, this class is responsible for efforts to align process documentation with training and testing requirements for projects and applications; leading comprehensive requirements gathering, process reengineering/optimization efforts, and monitoring activities that lead to better utilization of systems and resources and resolution of business and operational challenges; and designing and implementing plans to ensure continuous process improvement strategies are put into place to ensure all critical processes are routinely reviewed and updated as needed. Operating under general supervision of the Innovations and Business Solutions Manager, work is performed in accordance with established policies and procedures, with leeway allowed for the exercise of independent judgment in carrying out the details of the work. Performs related work as required.

EQUIPMENT OPERATED : Computer, calculator, communication equipment, and other equipment, as required

FULL PERFORMANCE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES : Thorough knowledge of safety rules, regulations, and procedures; thorough knowledge of Microsoft Office software applications, to include Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint, and Visio; ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing; ability to evaluate diverse data sets (financial results, operational metrics, systems data, etc.) and determine critical needs and cause/effect relationships; ability to isolate key information and determine the impact of process or procedural changes; ability to use critical thinking skills to identify effective and efficient solutions for complex problems; ability to quickly grasp new practices and derive opportunities for improvement; ability to effectively communicate complex information to a variety of audiences; ability to quickly adapt to evolving needs and priorities; knowledge of and ability to apply best practices in process optimization/reengineering across diverse work flows; ability to manage and direct activities of diverse teams; knowledge of process mapping techniques, to include critical examination of routes/exceptions and consensus building; ability to analyze data, make decisions, and facilitate continuous process improvement efforts across all divisions; ability to manage multiple process initiatives and deadlines; knowledge of and experience using change management principles, methodologies and tools; ability to develop communications to effectively share information related to process changes that impact employees and/or customers; and ability to work independently and deliver outcomes as planned.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS :

(A) Graduation from a four (4) year accredited university/college with a Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, engineering, project management or related field (Master’s degree or relevant certification preferred), and a minimum of five (5) years of relevant experience and similar responsibilities; OR

(B) Graduation from two (2) year Community/Technical College with an Associate’s degree in business, finance, engineering, or related field with a minimum of nine (9) years of experience as defined in (A) above.



SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS : Must possess and maintain a valid North Carolina Driver’s License. Preferred Lean Six Sigma certification. Preferred three (3) years of experience in document & digital management.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS : Must be able to perform the essential functions of the position.

SAFETY HAZARDS : Minimal.

PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT : As required in the Public Works Commission’s Safety Manual.

EMPLOYER'S RIGHTS : This job description is general and illustrative of the kind of duties required of this position. It is not exhaustive and does not contain a detailed description of all the duties that may be assigned to the incumbent occupying this position.

Job Title: IT Sr Technical Specialist, Analytics Analyst
Job Description:
Labcorp is a leading global life sciences company that provides comprehensive diagnostic and drug development services to patients, physicians, and healthcare organizations. Our mission is to improve health and improve lives by delivering world-class diagnostic solutions, drug development services, and technologies to advance medicine and improve patient care.
IT Sr Technical Specialist, Analytics Analyst

Labcorp IT seeks an experienced IT professional for the role of IT Sr Technical Specialist, Analytics Analyst. will be part of a newly formed division supporting laboratory partnerships and acquisitions and will collaborate with IT, vendor, business, laboratory operations, and partnership stakeholders to ensure successful LIS implementations. The IT Sr Technical Specialist will demonstrate a working knowledge of the Cerner Millennium Analytics and Lights On Modules, Laboratory operations and the ability to learn complex processes and technology quickly.

Responsibilities:

Serves as a member of the broader LIS implementation team and collaborates in accomplishing defined strategic LIS initiatives for the Health System Operating Division.
Contributes to the development of the overall IT strategy for LIS implementation; develops repeatable implementation processes for assigned laboratory initiatives.
Prepares and leads meetings at an appropriate cadence; uses excellent verbal and written communication.
Partners with operations leaders to identify site-specific requirements that impact the deployment strategy.
Leads current state review and assesses current processes and workflows within the labs for any scope gaps or potential risks or issues.
Leads future state review to demo all workflows.
Assists with decision making and completes the Data Collection Workbooks to capture data for LIS configuration.
Plans and manages the configuration of the solution into the system.
Raises integration points with workstreams where there is crossover with other workstreams.
Applies technical expertise to build design, configuration, and execution.
Documents lessons learned to ensure ongoing success with future initiatives.
Fosters a collaborative environment by establishing a team atmosphere of candor, trust, and mutual respect.
Supports the laboratories through cutover and transition to support.

Education and Qualifications:

A BA (Bachelor of Arts) or BS (Bachelor of Science) degree is required.
5+ years of IT experience including extensive Cerner Millennium Analytics build experience including Data Analytics 2, CCL and Lights On. Implementation experience for multi facility projects is strongly recommended.
Laboratory clinical experience is recommended.
A solid understanding of the Laboratory industry and Laboratory workflows and how the LIS impacts and is impacted by surround technologies to include Revenue Cycle, Electronic Health Records, etc.
Critical thinking skills and the ability to translate abstract information into a consumable format.

Data Analyst:

Job Title: GB/GM AML Data Analytics & Reporting - Quantitative Analyst
Job Description:
Job Description:

About Us:

At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.

One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.




Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.




Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

Job Description:

The Global Banking & Markets Anti-Money Laundering (GB&GM AML) organization is a central control function which governs, facilitates, and oversees the global end-to-end GB&GM AML program across all Global Banking and Global Markets businesses and jurisdictions through the implementation of processes and controls to effectively managing AML and economic sanctions risks. The team performs AML Know-Your-Client/Client Due Diligence (KYC/CDD) and covers refresh (periodic review) as its core activity. Additionally, there is a dedicated team responsible in reaching out to clients for KYC/CDD documentations in order to fulfil its due diligence requirements. The team also covers internal/external audits and remediation of AML KYC/CDD of bank clients.

One of the key requirements of the GB&GM AML Data Analytics & Reporting team is to create sophisticated, value-added analytics and reporting solutions that support operational efficiency & regulatory compliance in the Anti-Money Laundering and Know Your Customer space. The emphases is on effectively and accurately using data to drive operations and compliance.

What will your main responsibilities include?

Building relationships to facilitate cross-functional collaboration including GBAM Sales COOs, Refresh Operations, Global Financial Crimes, Risk & Compliance, Technology, as well as external consultants

Analyzing problems and identifying both tactical and strategic solutions; formulating multi-generational plans

Managing an initiative from end-to-end starting with understanding the business need, gathering requirements, setting expectations, analyzing the data, and delivering the final solution; with transparency throughout

Navigating multiple data environments and utilizing different analytics tools in order to transform data into actionable, data-driven solutions

Understanding relational databases containing customer, associate, product, and transaction data

Turning that data into insights in order to ‘tell the story’ and present findings to various levels of the organization, including senior management and risk leaders

Monitoring and testing the effectiveness of key controls and status of mitigation and/or action plans

Adherence to a strong risk culture, including champion/challenger roles, peer reviews, change management discipline, standardization of processes, and rigorous documentation

Striving for continuous process improvement through standardization and automation to reduce errors and increase efficiency

Required Skills:

Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Marketing, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or Economics)

2-5+ years of experience as Data Analyst, or similar role in financial services industry

4+ years demonstrating strong proficiency in utilizing data mining/analytics tools such as Toad, Teradata SQL Assistant, Microsoft SQL Server, SAS

Well versed in business analysis via Excel-based analytics, e.g. External Links, V-Lookups & Pivot Tables

Strong interpersonal and overall communication skills (written and verbal)

Highly motivated, proactive and a self-starter; strong sense of ownership & ability to create and execute plans without daily oversight

Must be flexible and have experience working in a fast paced & high pressure environment; managing multiple projects at once



Desired Skills:

Solid understanding and proficiency of BI tools like Tableau & Alteryx

Python/R knowledge

Knowledge of AML and/or GBAM businesses

Shift:

1st shift (United States of America)

Hours Per Week:

40

Overview/Risks:
Serve as technical team leader and work closely with business and technical partners across the enterprise to enable the implementation of end-to-end Business Intelligence solutions. Possess exceptional data transformation, warehousing and automation skills, as well as interpersonal skills to work cross-functionally and drive better data access and holistic analytics. Play a key role in the architecture, delivery and governance of reporting and data delivery
Responsibilities:
Manage reporting environments including data warehouse, data sources, security, licensing, and metadata.
Ensure evolving data warehouse is in lockstep with evolving analytics and reporting use cases, and partner with the infrastructure team to ensure the data warehouse scales with growth.
Responsible for planning, designing, configuring, developing, testing, deploying and supporting ETL/BI solutions. Develops and uses ETL applications to perform data analysis, create technical designs and provide applications support.
Partner cross-functionally with our infrastructure, engineering, and analytics teams to define and drive optimized data access and data-informed decision-making across the organization.
Write complex SQL scripts to extract data from variousdatabases and systems to make data available for enterprise reporting.

Facilitate automation of analytical and operational tasks and processes.
Create ope rational metrics and KPIs to improve data quality and operational efficiency.
Establish data management best practices to ensure completeness, cleanliness, and consistency across the entire data lifecycle.
Identify and revise enterprise reporting requirements.
Responsible for evaluation, installation, testing, implementation, maintenance and troubleshooting of new or upgraded BI Applications.
Troubleshoot reported problems pertaining to BI tools and database environments, working closely with other IT members, especially DBAs, Systems Analysts, BI Analysts and Systems Engineers, identifying the cause and designing / developing an approach for resolution.
Assess impact of changes and updates to source production systems, planning and implementing resulting changes to reports and dashboards.
Governance / Best Practices – adhere and contribute to enterprise data governance standards. Also educates andsupports colleagues in best practices to ensure that data is used appropriately.
Conduct end user training on BI systems.
Perform system administrator functions within software, including maintaining configuration of software, account management, maintaining system security.

Why Work at Lenovo

We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.

Lenovo is a US$62 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #171 in the Fortune Global 500, employing 77,000 people around the world, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, Lenovo has built on its success as the world’s largest PC company by further expanding into growth areas that fuel the advancement of ‘New IT’ technologies (client, edge, cloud, network, and intelligence) including server, storage, mobile, software, solutions, and services.

This transformation together with Lenovo’s world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit https://www.lenovo.com, and read about the latest news via our StoryHub.

Description and Requirements
Description and Requirements

We are currently seeking motivated, talented, and ambitious graduates from business, finance, and accounting programs, with an emphasis on data analytics, to join Lenovo’s Global Finance Talent Program (GFTP) in various locations around the world.


What is Lenovo GFTP?

The Global Finance Talent Program (GFTP) is multi-year accelerated career development program that is designed to cultivate early career finance professionals into emerging global leaders within Lenovo. Participants are located across the globe and rotate through diverse and exciting roles during the 3-year program. Formal training, mentoring, projects, special events and career coaching are also provided to facilitate the growth and development of our GFTP participants. We are looking for applicants with a passion for technology and a strong aptitude for finance who want to be part of a company that values ethics, diversity, inclusion, the environment, and business performance.



Learning Opportunities and Responsibilities:

During this full-time three-year development program participants will:

Rotate through three 12-month rotations within Lenovo finance organizations. This includes financial analysis and pricing within groups supporting multiple business, as well as financial audit, Centers of Excellence (COE), group control, etc. to establish a strong foundation of corporate accounting and finance knowledge.
Provide financial analysis and support to business groups that develop and sell a variety of products and services including PCs and tablets, monitors, accessories, smartphones, smart home, and smart collaboration solutions, augmented and virtual reality (AR/VR), commercial Internet of Things (IoT), software, services, and smart infrastructure data center solutions around the world.
Utilize financial and accounting concepts to provide profitability analysis, budget and forecast analysis, expense management, cost management, and basic tax, treasury, and accounting processes.
Participate and lead group projects within the finance group, and cross functionally through Lenovo Gigs and special initiatives, to demonstrate teamwork, leadership, and a continuous improvement mindset.
Participate in Lenovo and GFTP onboarding and training focused on strengthening early professional and financial skills as well as overall business acumen in the fast-paced, competitive world of technology.
Mentoring, job shadowing and engagement with finance leadership team members.
Ongoing exposure and training on Lenovo’s business strategy, key business initiatives, and end-to-end processes from new product and services development to customer delivery.
Upon completion of the GFTP, you will be prepared to assume key positions within the organization globally.


Basic Qualifications

Degree in business, finance, accounting, or related discipline obtained by June 2024 with an emphasis on data analytics.
This is an early career program accepting recent graduates typically with 2 years or less of related corporate experience (including internships).
Currently reside within commuting distance to the Lenovo US Headquarters in Morrisville NC, or within the United States and willing to relocate.


Preferred Skills and Abilities

Degree (masters preferred) in business, finance, accounting, or related discipline obtained by June 2024 with an emphasis on data analytics.
Willingness to flex working hours to support stakeholders and team members based in different countries and time zones as business needs require.
Excellent written and verbal communication, English required.
Passion for the Lenovo cultural attributes; Serving our Customers, Innovation, Entrepreneurship, and Teamwork with Integrity and Trust.
Ability to quickly gather, analyze and interpret data. Can use data to draw conclusions, influence others and drive decision making.
Strong accountability and ability to work independently while building and utilizing a network of internal resources to accomplish priorities.
Desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with high-energy and mission-driven colleagues.
Critical and strategic thinker with the ability to solve complex problems and present innovative solutions.

Manage and increase data platforms to ensure efficient and reliable data processing and analytics. Also, develop standards and procedures to ensure compliance with data privacy, security, and other industry best practices. You will report to the Director of Global Tech Solutions.

You Will:

Lead on administration and maintenance of data platforms, such as data warehouses, data lakes, and data integration tools. Ensure the platforms are configured, optimized, and secure.

Monitor and enforce data quality standards, ensuring data accuracy, completeness, and consistency across different data systems.

Implement data governance procedures to maintain data integrity and compliance with regulations.

Monitor the performance of data platforms and identify areas for improvement. Analyse system bottlenecks, increase queries, and fine-tune data pipelines to enhance overall efficiency.

Collaborate with data engineers to design ETL processes for data ingestion, transformation, and loading. This includes data modelling, data mapping, scripting, and scheduling of ETL jobs.

Implement and enforce security measures to protect sensitive data. You will define access controls, managing user permissions, and implementing encryption and authentication mechanisms.

Partner with teams to understand data requirements and collaborate on data-related projects.

Document data platforms, processes, and workflows to ensure knowledge transfer and facilitate efficient collaboration.

Investigate and resolve data-related issues, such as data discrepancies, system failures, or performance degradation. Provide support to data users and partners, ensuring data platform availability.

Ensure quality and standards are maintained, and that technology developments are tracked and reflected in our platform.

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, information Systems, or a related field.

Experience working as a Data Platform Analyst or related role

Previous use of tools such as PowerBI, Fusion, Oracle and Azure programs.

We offer benefit options in and out of the workplace, including life insurance, a retirement plan and annual leave. We care about our employees' welfare and focus our benefits package on the benefits which support your wellbeing. ```Duties:```
- Collect, analyze, and interpret data to identify trends and patterns

- Experience with the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies
- Ability to communicate complex findings in a clear and concise manner
- Strong problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail

Note: Experience with tools like Smash or Vaticinate is a plus but not required.

PBI Reporting Analyst




Essity is a dynamic and innovative organization in the Health and Hygiene sector, committed to delivering excellence in every aspect of our business. We are seeking a skilled and motivated Power BI Reporting Analyst to join our team and play a pivotal role in our data-driven decision-making process. If you are passionate about data analysis, have experience working with various data sources, and are adept at using Power BI, we want you to be a part of our team.




About the Role



We're looking for people who embody our values, aren't afraid to challenge, innovate, experiment, and move at a fast pace. We're always looking for ways to improve our products and ourselves. If this is you, we'd love to talk.



What You Will Do

As a Power BI Reporting Analyst, you will be responsible for the following:

Developing interactive and insightful reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Collaborating with Sales Incentive, Marketing, and CRM teams to understand their reporting, data analysis and business needs.
Gathering, cleaning, and transforming data from multiple sources, including SQL Server, SharePoint, Excel, MS Access, and others.
Regularly monitoring and maintaining existing reports, making necessary updates as the business requirements evolve.
Understanding SQL queries to extract and manipulate data as required.
Leveraging your advanced MS Excel skills to perform tasks such as Power Query Editor, VLOOKUP, and Pivot Tables.
Identifying trends and insights within the data to support decision-making processes.
Collaborating with team members to ensure data integrity and consistency in reporting.
Who You Are

The ideal candidate for the Power BI Reporting Analyst role should possess the following qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent work experience.
Proven experience with Power BI or similar Business Intelligence tools (Must have).
Familiarity with data sources like SQL Server, SharePoint, Excel, and MS Access.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to turn complex data into actionable insights with effective communication and excellent storytelling skills.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
Effective communication and presentation skills to convey complex information to non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented and able to work both independently and as part of a team, managing multiple tasks and priorities effectively.
A desire to stay up to date with industry best practices and trends in data analytics.
Experience presenting reports and insights to C-level executives is a plus.

The following qualifications are not required but would be considered a plus:

Microsoft Power BI Certification. (Microsoft PL-300)
Experience in the industry.
Familiarity with data visualization best practices.

Library Data Analyst

“Follow your calling, Find your career”

This position will be located at 101 Eastway Drive, Charlotte, NC 28213

This position is eligible for 3 days in the office and 2 days remote

Salary Range $58,259.87 - $87,389.81. This is an exempt position. Pay rates are based on education, skill, experience level and internal equity. Internal equity considerations include an assessment of the applicant’s salary history and qualifications in comparison to the market rate and requirements for the job.

Position Summary:
The Data Analyst at the library is responsible for documenting, collecting, organizing, and analyzing data to provide valuable insights that support evidence-based decision-making and improve the library's services and operations. They will collaborate with various departments to identify data needs, develop data collection strategies, and design efficient data management systems. They will create comprehensive reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data findings and recommendations to stakeholders.

Essential Functions:
Document, collect and gather data from various library systems, databases, and sources.

Clean, validate, and transform data to ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity.

Develop and implement data collection methods and procedures to capture relevant information.

Analyze data using statistical techniques and data mining tools to identify patterns, trends, and correlations.

Generate meaningful insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support evidence-based decision-making.

Create comprehensive reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present data findings to stakeholders in a clear and understandable manner.

Collaborate with different departments within the library to identify data needs and develop strategies to address them.

Assist in the evaluation and implementation of library programs and initiatives using data-driven approaches.

Maintain data management systems, ensuring data documentation, quality, security, and compliance with relevant regulations.

Act as a primary liaison with external partners to ensure effective coordination and reporting of performance data.

Minimum Qualification:
Experience: Minimum of two years’ experience in a related field.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, Data Analytics or a related field.
Combination of relevant education and relevant experience accepted?: Yes

Licenses and Certifications:
May require a valid North Carolina or South Carolina Driver's License
May require County Driving Privileges

Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, Data Analysis or a related field.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Library operations and services: Familiarity with the functions, resources, and services offered by libraries to understand the context and requirements of data analysis in a library setting.

Library management systems: Knowledge of library management systems, such as Integrated Library Systems (ILS) or Library Services Platforms (LSP), to extract relevant data and understand the structure and organization of library data.

Data privacy and confidentiality: Understanding of data privacy principles, such as personally identifiable information and consent, and regulations, such as the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), to ensure compliance and maintain confidentiality of library user data.

Research methodologies: Awareness of research methodologies and data collection techniques used in library science and information studies to effectively design data collection strategies and analyze data within a library context.

Data visualization principles: Understanding of best practices in data visualization to create clear, meaningful, and visually appealing charts, graphs, and dashboards for presenting data findings to stakeholders.

Statistical analysis techniques: Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques, including descriptive statistics, inferential statistics, regression analysis, and hypothesis testing, to conduct rigorous data analysis and interpret results accurately.

Data cleaning and data quality management: Proficiency in data cleaning techniques to identify and address data inconsistencies, errors, and missing values, and ensure high-quality data for analysis.

Data manipulation and querying: Ability to manipulate and query datasets using programming languages like SQL (Structured Query Language) or data manipulation tools like Excel or OpenRefine to extract, transform, and analyze data effectively.

Data security and data governance: Understanding of data security principles and best practices, as well as data governance frameworks, to ensure data protection, access control, and ethical use of data within the library's data management processes.

Skills:
Data collection and extraction: Ability to collect, extract, and retrieve relevant data from various sources, such as library databases, systems, APIs, or external sources.

Data cleaning and preprocessing: Skills in cleaning and preprocessing data to ensure data quality, consistency, and accuracy, including handling missing values, outliers, and data formatting issues.

Data analysis and statistical techniques: Proficiency in applying statistical techniques, data mining methods, and exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and insights within library data.

Data visualization: Skills in creating effective and visually appealing visualizations, charts, geospatial analyses, and graphs to communicate data findings and insights to stakeholders.

Database management: Familiarity with database management systems, including data querying, data manipulation, and database design, to handle large datasets efficiently.

Statistical software and tools: Experience with statistical software packages such as R, SPSS, or SAS, as well as data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI, to conduct advanced data analysis and generate visualizations.

Problem-solving and critical thinking: Ability to approach complex problems analytically, think critically, and devise innovative solutions using data-driven insights.

Communication and presentation: Strong communication skills to effectively convey data findings, insights, and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through written reports, presentations, and visualizations.

Continuous learning and adaptability: Willingness to stay updated with emerging technologies, methodologies, and best practices in data analysis, and adapt them to the specific needs and challenges of library data.

Abilities:
Identify and understand data needs and requirements within the library context.

Document, collect, organize, and manage large datasets from multiple sources.

Clean, validate, and preprocess data to ensure data quality and integrity.

Apply appropriate statistical analysis techniques to analyze and interpret data.

Generate meaningful insights and recommendations based on data analysis.

Create clear and informative reports, visualizations, and dashboards to present data findings.

Collaborate with various departments and stakeholders to understand their data requirements and provide data-driven solutions.

Collaborate with various departments and stakeholders to understand their data requirements and provide data-driven solutions.

Troubleshoot data-related issues and identify solutions to ensure accurate and reliable data analysis.

Computer Skills:
Advanced proficiency with analytic and technical software applications appropriate to position, e.g., Galvanize (ACL) or equivalent, Microsoft Office Suite, Power BI, etc.

Work Environment:
Works in an office setting with moderate noise

Job Title: Junior Data Quality Analyst - Charlotte NC
Job Description:
Who is ScentAir you ask? For more than 20 years, ScentAir has helped businesses across the globe create powerful customer experiences using fragrance, or as we like to call it “Scent Marketing”! We are the global market leader in Scent Technologies and Air Purification based here in Charlotte NC.


** Applicants For This Position Must Reside In The Charlotte Area For Consideration **

What is the Purpose of this position? This role will be responsible for improving data quality within our CRM and assisting the Sales Operations Team with the implementation of a global, data-led strategy. This role will report to the Senior Global Sales Operations Manager.

What are your Key Responsibilities?

Monitoring and reviewing data that is entered in the company’s CRM, checking for completion and accuracy.
Data cleansing using tools such as Ring Lead and Excel to identify, assess and resolve any data quality issues.
Developing data quality best practices guidelines and working with internal team leads across the organization to implement these guidelines.
Address the root causes of data inconsistencies and recommend improvements.
Review the large partnership global rosters to enter new locations and update changed locations.
Vertical database analysis with the responsibility of identifying new contacts and locations to add to the CRM.
Sales territory data analysis that provides valuable insights to North American sales leaders.


What are the Core Competencies?

Strong familiarity with Salesforce.com, MS Excel, and Teams
The Ability to review, analyze and manage large volumes of data
Outstanding attention to detail and a meticulous work approach
Strong organizational skills
The ability to work independently


Be A Part of Something Remarkable with Us! We don't just create remarkable experiences for our customers. We create them for ourselves, here, every day. At ScentAir, our work is as varied and fascinating as the experiences we help craft. Though we're already on every continent, we're still growing. So, we're always looking for diverse, multi-talented people that are passionate about making the world a more exciting place to breathe in.

Together, we are reimagining what's possible for our customers, our business, and ourselves. With limitless growth across our organization, the only thing missing is you!

rL6mKBwdco

You could be the one who changes everything for our 28 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.


Position summary: This position is responsible for the financial data analytic needs of the organization. The position will use a combination of financial analysis tools and techiques as well as data analysis tools and technologies to generate, analyze, report, and interpret financial and other data used across the organization.

Develop integrated revenue/expense analyses, projections, reports, and presentations


Create and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual reports and ensures financial information has been recorded accurately


Identify trends and developments in competitive environments and presents findings to senior management; strong process documentation skillset preferred


Perform financial forecasting and reconciliation of internal accounts


Support business initiatives through data analysis, identification of implementation barriers and user acceptance testing of various systems


Diagnose problems and identify opportunities for process redesign and improvement
Education: Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent experience. 2+ years of statistical or data analysis experience. Experience with financial analysis focused on month end close, government reporting, and financial forecasting. General knowledge of analysis tools, SQL, and Microsoft Applications.


Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.


Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

What You'll Do
The Cisco Data & Analytics Office (CDAO) team located within Cisco Information Technology is looking for a hands-on data analyst/engineer to support the Data & Analytics organization.
You will work closely with recurring metrics product owners and business stakeholders to develop solutions to compute recurring metrics, complete data assessment, and data engineering solutions for generating recurring operational metrics in an agile environment.
Responsibilities:
Works with business stakeholders to understand product capabilities.
Collaborates with recurring metrics product team to complete data assessment using SQL to extract data from Enterprise Data Foundation (EDF).
Documents solutions to build or change metric computation business rules.
Grooms proposed solutions with data engineering team.
Supports on-demand data extracts to meet business needs.
Who You'll Work with:
As a Data Analysis Manager, you will be working with a team of data product owners and other data engineers to formulate, assess and help develop data related solutions to enable Cisco of recurring business metrics, including iACV. You will also be an active participant in validating the metric data working with Finance & other cross functional teams.
Who you are:
Minimum Qualifications/Skills:
BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.
5+ years of working with Databases.
5+ years of SQL experience.
3+ years of XLS or other spreadsheets
Experience with GCP, Postgres sql and Teradata.
Experience with Tableau and other Reporting tools.
Experience with crafting User Stories & grooming with engineering.
Experience with or knowledge of Agile Software Development methodologies.
Experienced working with teams across multiple time zones
Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
Process oriented with phenomenal documentation skills.
Understanding of ETL processes is required.
Understanding of designing, building, and maintaining data processing systems.
Why Cisco?
#WeAreCisco. We are all unique, but collectively we bring our talents to work as a team, to develop innovative technology and power a more inclusive, digital future for everyone. How do we do it? Well, for starters – with people like you!
Nearly every internet connection around the world touches Cisco. We’re the Internet’s optimists. Our technology makes sure the data traveling at light speed across connections does so securely, yet it’s not what we make but what we make happen which marks us out. We’re helping those who work in the health service to connect with patients and each other; schools, colleges, and universities to teach in even the most challenging of times. We’re helping businesses of all shapes and sizes to connect with their employees and customers in new ways, providing people with access to the digital skills they need and connecting the most remote parts of the world – whether through 5G, or otherwise.
We tackle whatever challenges come our way. We have each other’s backs, we recognize our accomplishments, and we grow together. We celebrate and support one another – from big and small things in life to big career moments. And giving back is in our DNA (we get 10 days off each year to do just that).
We know that powering an inclusive future starts with us. Because without diversity and a dedication to equality, there is no moving forward. Our 30 Inclusive Communities, that bring people together around commonalities or passions, are leading the way. Together we’re committed to learning, listening, caring for our communities, whilst supporting the most vulnerable with a collective effort to make this world a better place either with technology, or through our actions.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco


Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S. and/or Canada:


When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. and/or Canada locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. or Canada hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.
U.S. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday, plus a day off for their birthday. Employees accrue up to 20 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) each year and have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues without tapping into their PTO. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. Employees are also able to purchase company stock through our Employee Stock Purchase Program.
Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco pays at the standard rate of 1% of incentive target for each 1% revenue attainment against the quota up to 100%. Once performance exceeds 100% quota attainment, incentive rates may increase up to five times the standard rate with no cap on incentive compensation. For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

Job Title: Population Health Analyst - Duke Health Technology Solutions - Remote
Job Description:
Duke Connected Care, a community-based, physician-led network, includes a group of doctors, hospitals and other healthcare providers who work together to deliver high-quality care to Medicare Fee-for-Service patients in Durham and itssurrounding areas.


Position Summary

The Population Health Analyst role is integral to the success of Duke’s Population Health Management Office (PHMO) strategic and operational goals. This position will be responsible for (1) the identification, analysis and interpretation of EMR, payor, and other data sources to support program evaluation; (2) guide analyses and decision making around continuous quality improvement activities; and (3) produce reports to support program decisions and operations. This position requires an analyst intrigued and driven by the challenge of creating information from data; skilled at organizing the presentation of quantitative information to facilitate understanding and illuminate decision making.




The PHMO department is the central entity within Duke Health responsible for the administrative and care management aspects of Duke’s value-based care contracts. This position will reside on the PHMO Data & Analytics team, reporting to the Reporting & Analytics Team Manager.

Duties and Responsibilities
Serve as liaison between business and the PHMO Data & Analytics team to provide first line of support for triaging requests, troubleshooting issues, and gathering requirements for new data requests.
Serve as liaison between PHMO Data & Analytics team and Payor Plan points of contact for resolution of data exchange issues and to triage new data request.
Serve as an individual contributor performing simple projects independently and more complex projects with assistance.
Run and distribute recurring reports monitoring for trends, variances or discrepancies that may indicate shifts in performance or data quality concerns.
Partner with business customers to elicit requirements for data/report requests.
Perform gap assessment to identify gaps between business requirements and data availability.
Partner with Reporting & Analytics team members to translate requirements into the right reporting solution to meet customer data needs.
Develop and implement an appropriate quality acceptance testing and validation strategy to ensure completeness and accuracy of data prior to user acceptance testing.
Proactively research and resolve report issues.
Collaborate with team on establishing and maintaining documentation of processes.
Maintain impeccable communication with internal and external stakeholders regarding the development status of work requests. Requires the timely and astute evaluation and anticipation of risks to fulfillment of requests.
Maintain knowledge of industry standards for metrics and analyses in a value based payment healthcare environment.


This position may have an opportunity to work remotely. All Duke University and Duke Health remote workers must reside in one of the following states or districts: Arizona; California; Colorado; Florida; Georgia; Hawaii; Illinois; Maryland; Massachusetts; Montana; New Jersey; New York; North Carolina; Pennsylvania; South Carolina; Tennessee; Texas; Virginia; or Washington, DC.

Required Qualifications

Education/Training:

Bachelor's degree in a related field. Degree in computer sciences, public health, or a health-related discipline preferred

Experience:

2+ years of experience as a data analyst or related position OR an equivalent combination of relevant education and/or experience

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Experience developing basic-moderate SQL queries preferred
Excellent analytical, problem-solving ability
Data validation
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to build strong working relationships with customer and team members to effectively achieve project goals.
Ability to handle a variety of projects and tasks simultaneously and prioritize competing deadlines
Prior experience with clinical, EHR, and healthcare claims data preferred.


The intent of this job description is to provide a representative level of the types of duties and responsibilities that will be required of positions given this title and shall not be construed as a declaration of the total of the specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Employees may be directed to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically presented in this description.




Duke is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing employment opportunity without regard to an individual's age, color, disability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or veteran status.

JOB SUMMARY

The Senior Business Data Analyst provides strategic and tactical support to the enterprise by analyzing and interpreting data for solutions. Develops rules and methodologies for effective Data Management. Uses knowledge of data analysis tools and other technology to provide data integration solutions. They are responsible for the development of an in-depth understanding and analysis of the data requirements for projects and ad-hoc reporting and analysis needs. This position influences senior management, technical leads and architects in achieving strategic goals by facilitating the data availability and quality of systems and processes. Provides technical and professional assistance for less experienced team members.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Competencies:
Responsible for both leading and participating in a team of analysts focused on the analysis, design, implementation, and follow up of the migration of data from the on-premises Enterprise Data Warehouse to the Azure Data Warehouse.
Leads and directs the work of others.
Lead research, planning, development and testing of data provisioning, analysis and ad-hoc reporting solutions.
Participates in developing the methodology for documenting data templates for various types of data.
The ability to extract and analyze data, patterns, and related trends, with the subsequent ability to synthesize the data into information consumable by senior business decisionmakers.
Reviews and ensures that major data architectural designs are consistent, maintainable, flexible and cost effective.
Understands industry trends, emerging technologies and standards in order to evolve the Standards and Roadmap.
Provides analysis to support development of vision, data strategy, data architecture and the overall design and development of Enterprise Data Warehouse as needed.
Provides consultation to application owners, business partners and peer groups regarding long and short-range data solutions that meet business requirements.
Diagnoses data problems effectively and determines solution options with consideration to business impact.
Adheres to enterprise architecture strategies, principals, standards, policies and procedures. Understands and ensures compliance with IT strategy.
Diagnose and fix bugs, performance and security issues
Be a champion of digital security
Ensure resources diagnose and fix bugs, performance and security issues
Document system architecture o Improve the overall quality and security of any related systems
Ensure access to data follows the principle of least privilege as required
Follows through with commitments.

Proactively initiates, develops, and maintains effective working relationships with team members.

- Self-starter - must be productive with minimal direction

Bachelor's degree or equivalent and work experience defined as 7 or more years of overall experience with data analysis for major software systems.

AT A GLANCE

As a Data Analyst for RVO Health, you drive problem-solving with autonomy, while being an expert at querying, transforming, and providing analytical insights. Our Data Analysts dig deep into the business and provide data solutions with advanced analytics, business intelligence and data science to drive success and enrich the user experience. As a Data Analyst, you will communicate, support, and strategize with business, tech, and data teams stakeholders. You will act as a data-savvy consultant, telling the data story by understanding processes, solving problems, and making business and marketing recommendations.

Where You'll Be

To prioritize togetherness, culture, and accountability, RVO Health operates on a hybrid in-office work schedule. We expect employees to work from our South Charlotte office Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday each week. You are welcome to work remotely Mondays and Fridays if you wish.

1101 Red Ventures Dr Fort Mill, SC 29707

What You'll Do
Provide strategic insights derived from digital marketing, web event, sales, and coaching data that drive marketing investment and customer experience decisions
Use statistics to identify the significance, noise, and correlation in data
Conduct hands-on advanced analytics using multiple data sources originating from different applications and systems
Build relationships with business teams and data science teams to identify opportunities for deep analytics on customer behavior and site performance
Build compelling visualizations and interactive dashboards that enable us to democratize analvtics
Work with data science, data engineers, and business teams to build scalable and effective data products
Identify opportunities to use advanced analytics to develop new strategies and improve business performance
What We're Looking For
Minimum of 2+ years of experience in complex business analysis, digital analysis, or marketing analysis role
Proficiency in visualization tools such as Looker or Tableau
Extensive experience in building SQL queries across complex relational database experience
Experience designing scalable data models and ETLs
Demonstrated ability to solve problems with creativity and little direction
Demonstrated ability to synthesize data into impactful insights and communicate recommendations to leadership
Effective interpersonal and communication skills, with a track record of working well with business stakeholders

Who We Are:

Founded in 2022, RVO Health is a new healthcare platform of digital media brands, services and technologies focused on building relationships with people throughout their health & wellness journey. We meet people where they are in their personal health journeys and connect them with both the information and the care they need. RVO Health was created by joining teams from both Red Ventures and UnitedHealth Group's Optum Health. Together we're focused on delivering on our vision of a stronger and healthier world.

RVO Health is comprised of Healthline Media (Healthline, Medical News Today, Psych Central, Greatist and Bezzy), Healthgrades, FindCare and PlateJoy; Optum Perks, Optum Store and the virtual coaching platforms Real Appeal, Wellness Coaching, and QuitForLife.

Enterprise Role Overview:

A Senior Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring data products and services are serviceable and valuable to users. Key responsibilities include working with users and development teams to ensure the data is fit for purpose, defining and monitoring the processes and controls that adhere to EDM Standards, and helping to triage and remediate data incidents. This role assists users with data queries and metadata, performs data analysis to reveal business insights, communicates data changes, and provides training to users so they understand and can access the data they need. A Senior Data Analyst is an individual contributor at a program level. They will work with the users to ensure data is accurate, complete and fit for purpose. Performs data analysis and helps construct reports to answer business questions and reveal business insights. Guides changes to data capture processes and data transformation logic. Maintains an inventory of all applications and data transformation in the data flow for the domain. Contributes to the definition and maintenance of the domain dictionary. Performs impact analysis of data changes, proactively communicates to and trains users on the changes. Assists in the definition, stewardship, quality control, metadata and access of data owned by respective domain. Implements and monitors required transport controls and maintenance of all required metadata to comply with EDM Standards for the data domain. Helps triage and resolve data incidents for the domain across Capture, Transport and Use in a timely manner. Aligns and monitors key performance indicators and internal controls.

Shift:

1st shift (United States of America)

Hours Per Week:

40
