Job Summary:

In this role, you will plan and prepare production schedules for the manufacture of device components for pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical and medical device companies. Analyze production specifications, plant capacity data, and determine manufacturing processes, tools, and other resource requirements. Plan and schedule workflow for production according to established manufacturing capability and lead times. Plan sequence of production, sterilization, and other manufacturing operations for guidance of production workers. Confer with department supervisors to determine status of assigned projects. Expedite operations that delay schedules and alters schedules to meet unforeseen conditions. Prepare lists of required materials, tools, and equipment. Prepare purchase orders to obtain materials required in processes.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Responsible for receiving activities:
Verify and inspect incoming shipments with the support of the material handler.
Accept shipments under the criteria defined by the organization.
Load receiving batches into SAP.
Escalate discrepancies, damages and any other issue that delay the SAP entry process.
Perform cycle counts and month end counts process:
Generate, perform, enter, and reconcile daily inventory cycle counts.
Generate, perform, & process SAP virtual inventory
Identify optimal material storage strategies for high usage materials that are susceptible to inventory count inaccuracies.
Identify and implement solutions to any inherent issues that have the potential to impact inventory accuracy and cause unplanned production downtime.
Issue and cycle count raw materials, bags, packaging materials, and intermediate products.
Provide backup support to strip stock and finished goods cycle count activities during peak workload periods.
Perform count to critical materials in a daily, weekly and/or monthly manner.
Perform count adjustments and work with Plant controller and Accountant on resolving any discrepancies prior to data entries in the system.
Conduct accurate inventories as scheduled for internal and external warehouses.
Compile the end of month inventory reconciliation.
Increase the inventory accuracy.
Collaborate with material handlers and provide training as needed to ensure accurate goods movements.
Analyze inventory levels and material locations daily, weekly, and monthly, utilizing systems technology.



Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Ensure that raw material Kanban levels are being followed and executed as designed.
Identify and implement cost savings ideas in all areas of the business that the incumbent is responsible to manage.
Liaise with internal and external customers and other departments as appropriate.
Participate in special project teams as assigned.
Perform special studies as requested or required within all areas of responsibility.
Consistently abide by and promote the plant safety program, quality and lean initiatives, training program and SOP’s.
Perform all other duties as requested or assigned relevant to the position/company.



Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in supply chain, Operations Management, Business or relevant field required



Work Experience:

Minimum 1 year of production planning experience using advanced MRP system within a manufacturing environment required
Attain and/or maintain forklift and electric lift operator certifications preferred



Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Previous manufacturing work experience preferred.
Support and contribute to continuous improvement programs and activities.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proven ability to develop reports and analyze data to initiate problem solving.
Must be a team player with ability to handle multiple simultaneous tasks and follow-up on requests.



Travel Requirements:

No travel required



Physical Requirements:

Light, exerting up to 20lbs/9kg of force frequently, and/or negligible amount of force frequently constantly to move objects. If the use of arm and/or leg control requires exertion of force greater than that of sedentary work and if the worker sits most of the time, the job is considered light work.



Additional Requirements:

Must be able to work assigned shift(s) with overtime as required to complete assignments if necessary. Sitting and/or standing for extended periods may occur as well as getting to and from offices and building sites. If specifically necessitated by customer requirements, must be able to see with or without corrective lenses and distinguish color differences for product and safety issues. Hearing ability should be sufficient to hear and react to audible alarms from distances up to 150 feet. The ability to be able to lift and carry various items up to 50 pounds for manufacturing positions or 30 pounds for administrative positions is required.

Company Name: University of North Carolina School of the Arts
Job Description:
Full/Part Time
Full-time


School/Department Information
Information Technologies


Primary Description of Work
The IT Analyst Programmer II position is part of the Enterprise Systems & Applications (ESA) group, a division within the IT department at UNCSA. This team consists of programming specialists and analysts responsible for the design, development, implementation, operation, and enhancement of administrative computer applications for all students, faculty, and staff at UNCSA. This division supports the university web presence, the university enterprise resource planning (ERP) system (Ellucian Banner), and various interfacing systems used by administrative offices across the campus. This group works closely with central offices across campus, including numerous steering committees, to ensure administrative systems meet the needs of the university.


Work Schedule and hours
40 hours per week


Description of Responsibilities and Duties
The position serves as the functional area technical support for Finance, Human Resources, and university units utilizing ERP Finance and Human Resources data. The IT Analyst Programmer II should demonstrate a technical understanding of the business processes mandated by administrative systems and their interfaces and train in those systems. The analyst is responsible for applications analysis, thorough testing & debugging, implementation, and documentation. This position will also help enhance and streamline business processes for UNCSA administrative offices using the ERP (currently Ellucian Banner) and other ancillary-related software.

The IT Analyst Programmer II is responsible for:
Banner Finance and HR product suite and migration to any future ERP applications.
Analyzing business user needs and developing strategies to meet needs.
Adhering to data management policies and procedures.
Maintaining change control and testing processes for modifications.
Liaising with vendors, IT team, UNCSO, and Financial Systems to assist in resolving problems with software products or systems.
Documenting processes, systems, and technical issues.
Participating in integration initiatives for third-party products interfacing with Finance and Human Resources data systems.
This position is responsible for performing testing and confirming functional users follow testing procedures to ensure the integrity of our systems. Testing occurs on many levels, including testing new applications or baseline applications that have been modified to make sure that the systems perform as designed. The IT Analyst Programmer II should know how to investigate and correct error codes to meet job specifications, and how to create test data as needed. The analyst is responsible for testing to ensure that programs are migrated to production without problems and works closely with vendors, IT, UNCSO, and Financial Systems to report and resolve issues. This position will be tasked with testing new and emerging technologies to make best-practice recommendations to management.
This position will work closely with internal customers and team members daily. The analyst will be expected to attend vendor conferences and meetings with representatives of UNCSA departments, other universities, and UNCSO.
Serves as a technical resource to assist the Senior Programmer Analyst in maintaining other systems and will be mentored and trained to eventually back up the Senior Programmer Analyst functions when necessary.
Assisting with Banner Student product suite when necessary.
Assisting with Ellucian Degree Works.
Banner to Finance, HR, and Student Datamart integration assistance as needed.
Scheduling server/database clones, module updates, and module patches.
Support of ancillary systems and applications, such as Evisions FormFusion, Evisions IntelleCheck, TouchNet, People Admin, and StarRez.
Development of Argos reports or Power BI dashboards as needed.
Support campus report writers.
Develop and deploy recurring and ad hoc reports for internal customers.
Knowledge of PL/SQL and T-SQL would be very helpful.

The primary responsibility of the IT Analyst Programmer II is scripting and automation of feeds, support of existing processes and ancillary systems, and system integrations.
Development of scripts and programs to enhance processes, primarily BASH, Perl, and PL-SQL scripts on the Linux batch servers.
Coordinate implementation and troubleshooting with data feeds, automated processes, and 3rd party integrations.
The analyst will not be responsible for System Administration of the Linux servers. However, they will work with UNC System Office which administers those Linux systems. The analyst will mainly be responsible for file operations, creating/running scripts and data transfers, compiling source code, installing interfaces, and tracking errors from logs.

Other duties as assigned.


Minimum Qualifications
This is a mid-career position with Bachelor’s degree from an appropriately accredited institution and 2-4 years related experience, Master’s degree with 1-2 years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience in a higher education environment. This position will often make decisions with institution-wide impact in multiple systems.


Preferred Qualifications
Working experience supporting an ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) application.
Working experience with SQL (Oracle PL/SQL or Microsoft Transact-SQL a plus).
The ideal candidate should have knowledge of and experience with the additional following environments and tools: Banner Finance, Banner Human Resources, Self-Service Banner, and Banner Security.
A demonstrated technical understanding of the business processes mandated by administrative systems and their interfaces.
The ability to work as an independent, productive, responsible, self-motivated member of a team in high-pressure situations.
Working experience in any of our key systems including, but not limited to Evisions FormFusion, Evisions IntelleCheck, People Admin, and StarRez.


Terms of Employment
S1 12 month


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Linux, BASH scripting, and Perl scripting.
Application support experience.
Ability to conduct research into administrative system issues and products as required.
Ability to analyze and interpret data and to communicate technical information clearly and effectively to individuals at all levels of the organization with varying levels of understanding.
Effective oral and written communication skills. This analyst must possess effective technical writing skills to translate technical issues into understandable terms for non-technical functional users. Therefore, this position should be able to write professional, clear, concise, and complete systems documentation as well as communications for functional users, other internal customers, IT personnel, management, and vendors.
Ability to develop and maintain detailed documentation for processes and solutions.
The ability to work with team members and work independently on projects while communicating regular status reports to management.
Self-motivated and capable of working both individually and in a team environment. This person must be capable of multitasking and organizing their work. This position will work with other Enterprise Systems & Applications (ESA) members to create, enhance, and maintain real-time and flat file data interfaces between Ellucian Banner Finance, Ellucian Banner HR, and other cloud-based or on-premises systems.
The IT Analyst Programmer II should participate in on-the-job training, attend classes, and be driven to improve technical skills and increase professional capabilities.


Special Conditions for Eligibility

Looking to use your data analysis skills to make a difference? Want to transform labor market statistics into solutions that will benefit North Carolina's workforce and economy? The LEAD Labor Market Data Analyst transposes complex data and information on North Carolina's labor market into meaningful insights that help local and state customers better understand the economy and make informed business, employment, and educational decisions. This position analyzes public and confidential datasets using statistical software and prepares presentations, briefs, articles, reports, and visualizations to communicate results and implications to a wide variety of audiences - from state leaders to students and job seekers. The Labor Market Data Analyst combines their subject knowledge of economics, statistics, and social science research with creativity and curiosity to identify and initiate research and analyses to solve labor market challenges. The position is also responsible for responding to customers' data and labor market questions; contributing technical support to other research, statistical, and analytical work; and turning analyses into products that can be readily consumed by a variety of customers.
This position is housed in the Labor and Economic Analysis Division (LEAD) of the NC Department of Commerce and supports the economic, community, and workforce development of the state. LEAD is the state's premiere resource to labor market, workforce, and economic data, analysis, and insights.

This position will be located at 301 N Wilmington, St., Raleigh, NC. Depending on business need and job suitability, this position may be a candidate for telework, subject to management approval.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities / Competencies

Qualified applicants must submit an application that clearly reflects work experience that demonstrates the following:



Demonstrated experience conducting statistical analysis and economic research.
Experience in public policy, economics, or social sciences.
Experience creating visual data such as dashboards or reports and present the information verbally.
Demonstrated experience using software such as R, Python, SAS, SQL, Microsoft Power BI, or Tableau.
Advanced skills using Microsoft Excel such as pivot tables, VLOOKUP, and formulas.
Knowledge of labor market concepts.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Ability to transform complex information into clear deliverables.
Excellent written and verbal communication abilities.
Collaborative teamwork and project management skills.
Applicant must meet both the Minimum Education and Experience Requirement and all posted Knowledge, Skills and abilities/Competencies requirements to be considered qualified for the position.

Minimum Education and Experience Requirements

Some state job postings say you can qualify by an “equivalent combination of education and experience.” If that language appears below, then you may qualify through EITHER years of education OR years of directly related experience, OR a combination of both. See oshr.nc.gov/experience-guide for detail.



Bachelor’s degree in a discipline related to the field assigned to the position from an appropriately accredited institution and three years of related experience; or
An equivalent combination of education and experience.

Dentsply Sirona is the world’s largest manufacturer of professional dental products and technologies, with a 130-year history of innovation and service to the dental industry and patients worldwide. Dentsply Sirona develops, manufactures, and markets a comprehensive solutions offering including dental and oral health products as well as other consumable medical devices under a strong portfolio of world class brands. Dentsply Sirona’s products provide innovative, high-quality and effective solutions to advance patient care and deliver better and safer dentistry. Dentsply Sirona’s global headquarters is located in Charlotte, North Carolina. The company’s shares are listed in the United States on NASDAQ under the symbol XRAY.


Bringing out the best in people




As advanced as dentistry is today, we are dedicated to making it even better. Our people have a passion for innovation and are committed to applying it to improve dental care. We live and breathe high performance, working as one global team, bringing out the best in each other for the benefit of dental patients, and the professionals who serve them. If you want to grow and develop as a part of a team that is shaping an industry, then we’re looking for the best to join us.




Working at Dentsply Sirona you are able to:




Develop faster - with our commitment to the best professional development.




Perform better - as part of a high-performance, empowering culture.




Shape an industry - with a market leader that continues to drive innovation.




Make a difference -by helping improve oral health worldwide.






Job Summary:

This role is responsible for providing business analysis and reporting to field sales, sales management, and other cross functional departments within the organization. This is a hybrid position requiring two or more days a week in the office, located in Charlotte, NC.

Key Responsibilities:

Serve as a functional expert to management by providing accurate, consistent, and actionable analytics.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather, analyze, and interpret commercial data, including revenue, pricing, product performance, and customer behavior.
Provide insights through business-friendly recommendations resulting from comprehensive analysis.
Analyze market / competitor trends to provide guidance for forecasting, new product launches and commercial strategy.
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities in sales data to support strategic decision-making and enhance sales effectiveness.
Work with peer teams, pricing, sales, and marketing to align and execute strategy.
Develop reporting to track the effectiveness of strategies, provide insights to commercial team. Suggest corrective actions as indicated.
Provide root-cause analysis of KPIs to support business reviews with leadership.
Continuously interact with the sales team, customers, and others with relevant expertise to gain qualitative insights about Dentsply Sirona and its stance in the dental industry.
Gain company and industry knowledge as needed to fulfill roles and responsibilities.
Apply statistical models and other advanced analytical techniques to solve complex problems.
Work alongside technical resources to scale your work through process automation and self-service solutions.
Write SQL queries to combine and shape disparate data for analysis.
Develop Power BI reports for interactive analytical output.
Develop a strong understanding of the internal data environment and the limitations and capabilities throughout. Create business cases supporting the need for additional sources or changes to these systems.
Challenge the status quo while respecting the involved process of change.
Demonstrates initiative to resolve problems and find creative solutions to challenges.
Provide ad-hoc analysis, reporting and data interpretation to key internal customers as necessary.
Ensure accuracy of work and follow all compliance policies and procedures.
Acts within scope of authority and consistent with company and corporate objectives, guidelines, policies, and practices.
Perform other duties as required by management.

Education:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent from an accredited college or technical school

Years and Type of Experience:

3+ years of relevant work experience in an analytic role.
2+ years working with or around machine learning or statistical models.
2+ years writing SQL with complex joins in relational databases.
2+ years building and using BI tools like Tableau or Power BI.
Experience working in an Azure-Databricks cloud environment preferred.

Key Required Skills, Knowledge, and Capabilities:

Excel power user, including Power Pivot, Data Analysis.
Familiarity with advanced analytics tools such as Python, R, or SQL for data manipulation, statistical analysis, and modeling
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView to create interactive dashboards and reports that convey insights effectively.
Understanding of the diverse types of machine learning models and the ability to determine which can be applied to solve a complex problem.
Mathematical skills must be strong to perform calculations, understand concepts and correlations and to validate data outcomes.
Process oriented, ability to scale analytical output and reduce repetitive work.
Results oriented. Excellent time management skills with a focus on meeting deadlines.
Advanced critical thinking skills to solve complex problems systematically.
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers and other internal business partners.
Curiosity to ask for more context and understanding from stakeholders. Ability to see the forest through the trees and add value above the initial request.
Willingness to stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in business intelligence, analytics, and sales operations.
Manage complex, multi-stage projects spanning over several months.
Ability to collaborate with multiple cross functional teams.
Ability to respect and maintain the confidential nature of information collected and shared.
Must display interpersonal skills and ability to interact with internal customers, and other stakeholders in a professional and tactful manner.
Proficient in Word and PowerPoint
Exhibits a high degree of professionalism and resilience.
Strong results orientation with a continual customer focus
High degree of integrity and ethics

Job Title: Lead Business Functional Analyst – Strategic Data Archive Onboarding Engineer - Assistant Vice President
Job Description:
Lead Business Functional Analyst – Strategic Data Archive Onboarding Engineer - Assistant Vice President
Job ID: R0293127
Full/Part-Time: Full-time


Regular/Temporary: Regular
Listed: 2023-10-27


Location: Cary


Position Overview

Job Title Lead Business Functional Analyst – Strategic Data Archive Onboarding Engineer

Corporate Title Assistant Vice President

Location Cary, NC

Who we are

In short – an essential part of Deutsche Bank’s technology solution, developing applications for key business areas.

Our Technologists drive Cloud, Cyber and business technology strategy while transforming it within a robust, hands-on engineering culture. Learning is a key element of our people strategy, and we have a variety of options for you to develop professionally. Our approach to the future of work champions flexibility and is rooted in the understanding that there have been dramatic shifts in the ways we work.

Having first established a presence in the Americas in the 19th century, Deutsche Bank opened its US technology center in Cary, North Carolina in 2009. Learn more about us here .

Overview

Strategic Data Archive is an internal service which enables application to implement records management for regulatory requirements, application decommissioning, and application optimization. You will work closely with other teams providing hands on support onboarding by helping them define record content and metadata, configuring archiving, supporting testing and creating defensible documentation that archiving was complete. You will need to both support and manage the expectations of demanding internal clients.

What We Offer You

A diverse and inclusive environment that embraces change, innovation, and collaboration

A hybrid working model with up to 60% work from home, allowing for in-office / work from home flexibility, generous vacation, personal and volunteer days, a commitment to Corporate Social Responsibility

Employee Resource Groups support an inclusive workplace for everyone and promote community engagement

Access to a strong network of Communities of Practice connecting you to colleagues with shared interests and values

Competitive compensation packages including health and wellbeing benefits, retirement savings plans, parental leave, and family building benefits, educational resources, matching gift and volunteer programs

What You’ll Do

Provide responsive customer service (helping internal clients understand and efficiently manage their records management risks), manage expectations and provide regular updates- frequently to senior stakeholders

Explain our archiving services (both the Business value and technical implementation), respond promptly to inquiries, and configure archiving in test environments (will not be coding new functionality but will be making configuration changes maintained in a code repository and deployed with standard tools)

Support the documentation and approval of requirements including record content and metadata

Identify and facilitate implementing an efficient solution to meet the requirements

Support testing ensuring clients have appropriately managed implementation risks, and help issue resolution including data issues, environment challenges, and code bugs

Promote configurations from test environments to production and work with Production Support to ensure archiving is completed and evidence

Skills You’ll Need

Extensive experience implementing Information Technology (IT) solutions in a global financial institution in a client-facing role

Expertise with relational databases, Structured Query Language (SQL) and JSON

Desire and ability to learn new skills as required (e.g., Google Cloud Suite)

Knowledge of financial markets

Skills That Will Help You Excel

High degree of accuracy and attention to detail, Ability to communicate (written and verbal) concisely both business concepts and technical details and to influence partners including senior mangers

High analytical capabilities and able to quickly grasp new contexts – we support multiple areas of the Bank

Ensure deliverables are clearly documented, hold self and others accountable for meeting those deliverables, deliver against tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment, and manage other’s expectations and meet commitments

Ability to identify risks at an early stage and implement mitigating strategies

Flexibility and willingness to work autonomously and collaboratively, work in virtual teams, agile environment and in matrixed organizations, Treat everyone with respect and embraces diversity

Expectations

It is the Bank’s expectation that employees hired into this role will work in the Cary office in accordance with the Bank’s hybrid working model.

The salary range for this position in Cary is $105,000 to $160,000. Actual salaries may be based on a number of factors including, but not limited to, a candidate’s skill set, experience, education, work location and other qualifications. Posted salary ranges do not include incentive compensation or any other type of remuneration.

Deutsche Bank provides reasonable accommodations to candidates and employees with a substantiated need based on disability and/or religion.

Deutsche Bank Values & Diversity

We believe talent is found in all cultures, countries, races, ethnicities, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs, generations, backgrounds, and experiences. We pursue a working environment where everyone can be authentic and feel a sense of belonging. Click here to find out more about our diversity and inclusion efforts.

At Deutsche Bank, we recognize that our benefit programs have a profound impact on our colleagues. That’s why we are focused on providing benefits and perks that enable our colleagues to live authentically and be their whole selves, at every stage of life. We provide access to physical, emotional, and financial wellness benefits that allow our colleagues to stay financially secure and strike balance between work and home. Click here to learn more!

SUMMARY OF POSITION

Assess potential data sources and design plans to integrate, centralize, protect and maintain the data. Develop, implement and collaborate on data projects. May serve as lead data authority. Opportunity to work on a variety of applications and develop solutions that meet the organizational needs of the cooperative. There are a variety of data sources and structures to include: ESRI Geodatabases, MSSQL, Oracle, Excel, Tableau, and others.

JOB DUTIES

Essential Job Duties

Compute and evaluate data, create visualizations and reports, and communicate data insights to fellow employees and consumers.
Perform data management tasks, including uploading and downloading files between multiple systems and applications.
Assist project management in the development of current and future project designs.
Deliver data-driven reports and mapping built using enhanced data presentment and data visualization techniques
Collaborate with other team members to identify data-related issues and propose solutions.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and management.

Other Job Duties/Functions

Other duties as assigned

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Must have technical training in electrical principles and some experience in electrical distribution.
Experience in ESRI Geodatabases, SQL, PostgreSQL, Access, Excel, Power BI, MS Azure, Tableau and MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook, etc.), with the ability to create complex spreadsheets and manipulate data.
Experience with data management tasks such as uploading and downloading files between multiple systems and applications.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to train others on the use of spreadsheets and databases.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Must be able to pass background required to gain access to Fort Liberty.
A valid NC driver’s license is required throughout employment for travel to various facilities and job sites.

Education and Experience:

4-year college degree, or equivalent experience.
5 years of experience in data analysis

Physical Requirements:

Climbing, standing, stooping, or typing.
Ability to lift up to 50 pounds; occasional lifting over 50 pounds.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Normal work days are weekdays 7:30 am until 4:30pm, but required to work additional time as needed.
Generally accepted office conditions, but exposed to outside weather conditions about 25% of the time.
Occasional travel and overnight stays will be required.
Available to work during adverse weather conditions. Subject to be called in to work major outages.

GIS Analyst

ABOUT THIS POSITION:

EXPECTED HIRING RANGE: 68,358.00 - 83,739.00

WORK LOCATION: 73 Hunter Street, Apex, NC 27502

SCHEDULE: Monday - Friday 8:00am - 5:00 pm. In office

POSTING CLOSING DATE: Open Until Filled. Posting may close at any time without notice.




WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

Performs responsible technical work in the daily administration and operation of the Town’s Geographic Information System (GIS) services.

An employee in this class is responsible for the daily management of Geographic Information System (GIS) components, which includes the collection, verification, analysis, querying, storage, archiving, distribution and maintenance of information related to physical phenomena. Work includes the collection and verification of data; maintaining accurate and current metadata; creating layers, layouts and analyses in response to requests; creating interactive web maps and data; maintaining GIS software; advising Town department users, and working with outside consultants, Town staff, County staff, and neighboring municipal GIS staff to coordinate usages.

This employee works under the supervision of the GIS Administrator and develops GIS-based solutions to respond to various department and Town needs and requests.

A SAMPLE OF THE ESSENTIALS:

Manages (i.e. collects, obtains, analyzes, queries) and provides quality assurance of geospatial data.
Maintains, archives, and distributes geospatial data while assuring its effectiveness by keeping the
associated metadata current and accurate.
Designs and outputs maps and graphics as visual representations of geospatial data and analysis;
creates maps and presents data as requested.
Reviews requests for special maps and data layers, estimates time of completion, and produces
analysis, queries maps for use by town departments, outside agencies and the public.
Trains new users on GIS software and assists users in finding spatial information.
Creates and maintains a wide variety of databases and maps for assistance in data analysis, decision
making, documentation, and presentation.
Provide solutions using GIS, other technical knowledge and professional standards to find
one or more possible solutions that meet user’s needs.
Participates in an internal, town-wide major user group to advance standardization,
centralization (where appropriate) and shared usage within the Town’s overall GIS
implementation.
Creates and updates interactive web maps and data on the Town’s online mapping site.
Compiles and integrates geospatial data from outside sources; analyzes errors in digital file
exchange and corrects errors.
If assigned, supervises daily tasks of GIS Technician(s) and/or Specialist.
Performs other duties as required.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED:

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a four-year degree in GIS, geography, planning, or related field and considerable experience with GIS software and in data analysis; or any equivalent combination of education and experience.


Special Requirement:
GIS-P certification, MGIST, or ability to attain such certification in timeframes specified by the Town.




WITH...

Thorough knowledge of geographic and GIS principles.
Thorough knowledge of the operation of GIS software, hardware, and related peripherals.
Thorough knowledge of cartography and visual communication, including but not limited to design,
aesthetics, and presentation.
Thorough knowledge of web-based GIS and presentation including public web application
development.
General knowledge of the Town’s zoning, land use, and other related ordinances.
General knowledge of municipal assets and systems such as utilities, transportation and public
works.
Highly skilled in the use of GIS software, particularly ESRI based applications.
Skilled in the use of Cityworks, AutoCAD and Adobe Creative Suite.
Ability to perform complex analysis of GIS and related data to solve problems, analyze data for
trends or relevant findings, prepare written and graphical representations for management, the
Council and/or the Public.
Ability to interpret local ordinances as well as North Carolina General Statutes.
Ability to read blueprints, tax maps, recorded plats, construction drawings, and other development-related
drawings.
Ability to understand and carry out complex written and oral instructions.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships and communicate effectively with
surveyors, contractors, developers, staff from other municipalities, Town departments, and the
general public.
Ability to determine alternative means to display a variety of information and to utilize databases
and GIS technology to effectively present information for use by others.
Ability to solve technical issues with various software and hardware.
Performs related duties as required.

WHO WE ARE:

Known as "The Peak of Good Living", the Town of Apex is a rapidly growing Wake County municipality with a current population of 70,000 and was ranked in 2015 as Money Magazine's Best Place to Live in America. Our current workforce is comprised of over 540 full-time employees and over 125 part-time/seasonal staff. Our Human Resources Department - with the support and confidence of Town leadership - is committed to providing best-in-class HR programs for our employees, with a mission to create a culture of empowerment and accountability that maximizes individual and organizational potential. We offer a generous benefits package, and have a highly competitive compensation program. More than that, the Town is an awesome place to work, as evidenced by the 96% job satisfaction rating received in the last employee opinion survey conducted with our employees.

WHAT WE OFFER:

Not only is the Town "The Peak of Good Living", but it's also a great place to work! We strive to "reach the peak" of being an employer of choice by providing competitive salaries and excellent benefits, including:

Paid medical, dental, vision, and life insurance for employees
5% contributions to the NC401(k) retirement plans (no matching required)
Participation in the Local Government Employees' Retirement System (LGERS), 6% contribution by employee
Traditional sick and vacation leave
80 hours Peak Paid Time Off per year (after completion of probation)
$1,200 Peak Lifestyle Benefit to pay for health and wellness activities (after completion of probation)
Paid parental, caregiver, community involvement, and bereavement leave
13 paid holidays
Longevity pay
Tuition assistance
Expansive wellness program, and more!

KEEP IN MIND:

Providing a safe work environment for our employees is a top priority, therefore all new hires must successfully complete a pre-employment drug test, post-offer functional testing (if required by position), background verifications including references, criminal record and driver's license checks prior to employment.

The Town of Apex provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, sex, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, political affiliation or marital status, veteran status, or genetic information.

Training Resource Analyst

Job Category: Training

Time Type: Full time

Minimum Clearance Required to Start: TS/SCI

Employee Type: Regular

Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10%

Type of Travel: Local

What You’ll Get to Do:

As a CACI-SOAS Special Operations Forces Emerging Threats, Operations, and Planning Support (SOFETOPS) Training Resource Analyst, you will work within the enterprise-wide strategic training methodology framework to collect, analyze, and integrate training requirements to support the Planning, Programming, Budget, and Execution (PPBE) process for 2nd Special Warfare Training Group (Airborne), United States Army John F. Kennedy Special Warfare Center and School (USAJFKSWCS). You will conduct analysis of Program of Instruction (POI) to determine the resource requirements needed to fully support courses and meet organizational performance needs. Provide uniform methodology for defining training resource requirements from HQDA, TRADOC, USSOCOM, TSOC, USASOC, and SOCoE to unit level that is based upon an approved force structure.

More About the Role:

Other duties include but are not limited to:

Maintain analyst workbooks and supporting documentation.
Compile data for inclusion into reports and/or briefings.
Ensures equipment, manpower, facilities, and other resource needs are derived from HQDA, TRADOC, USSOCOM and SOCoE cost models.
Analyzes data, system operations, methods, inputs/outputs, and activities to identify resources required and recommend improvements along with coordinating activities to produce a more effective program.
Prepare functional analysis of management and training challenges and constraints.
Design workable solutions of alternative courses of action.
Compile data for inputs into periodic Training Resource Reports
Prepare cost assessments and projections as part of training analysis process.
Analyze and evaluate programs and issues related to manpower, materiel modernization, long-term and short-term strategic planning, and resourcing requirements, to include doctrine, organization, training, material, leadership & education, personnel, and facilities (DOTMLPF).
Provide training resource analysis of data, system operations, methods, inputs/outputs, and activities to identify gaps in resources and recommend improvements.
Collaborate with subject-matter experts to adapt research strategies to account for data limitations and time constraints.
Apply analysis of future concepts in joint operations to include integration of new constructs, organizations, Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs), and policy.
Interface with external entities to collect data.
Develop technical reports, briefings, and other finished products.

You’ll Bring These Qualifications:

Current Top Secret security clearance with SCI eligibility.
Minimum of 10 years of experience in Special Forces at tactical and operational levels.
Demonstrated familiarization with the Army Training Management Program and large-scale, enterprise-wide training programs.
Experience integrating information, analysis, technology, and interagency collaboration, lessons learned, and best practices for training support to enable effective analysis of training resource requirements.
Proven understanding of and experience with readiness resource requirements, culminating training events, Combat Training Centers (CTC), regional training centers, and home-station training events.
Proficient level use of Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access).

These Qualifications Would Be Nice to Have:

Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree.
Demonstrated operational or institutional training domain experience and integration across Doctrine, Organization, Training, Materiel, Leadership & Education, Personnel, and Facilities (DOTMLPF).
Demonstrated working knowledge of Program Objective Memorandum (POM).
Demonstrated working knowledge of Planning, Programming, Budget, and Execution (PPBE) process.

What We Can Offer You:

CACI-Special Operations and Asymmetric Solutions Operating Group resides within CACI’s Operations Support and Services Sector. As the premier provider of Special Operations capabilities; Tactical Advisory and Embedded Support; intelligence Applications to Law Enforcement; security cooperation and OCONUS Training Support Delivery for the company, CACI-SOAS has a reputation for uncompromising standards of quality in its people and its performance. Joining the CACI-SOAS team is a mark of excellence for those employees who complete our rigorous Mission-Focused Staffing process.
CACI-SOAS’s mission places its personnel against the government’s most critical emerging challenges. Work with us, and you’ll be working with a team making a difference across the globe.
CACI-SOAS offers competitive benefits, generous flex time off as well as numerous learning and development opportunities.
As the Prime Contractor for this effort, CACI-SOAS offers unmatched stability and growth potential within the program.

Company Overview: At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

Description

Become part of an inclusive organization with over 40,000 diverse employees, whose mission is to improve the health and well-being of the unique communities we serve.

Summary:
Responsible for assisting Compliance management in compliance activities which could include reviewing internal processes, documents and reports, and ensuring compliance with internal and external regulatory framework. Serves as a resource to physicians, coders and reimbursement analysts across UNC Health Care.


Responsibilities:
1. Auditing and Monitoring - Stays current with changing regulations, policies, procedures, standards and coding guidelines. The individual effectively identifies and analyzes areas of weakness, research causes and formulate recommendations that enhance operations and compliance. Familiarizes self with area under review, and if necessary, visits department/facility to gain operational and process knowledge. Researches all relevant materials including but not limited to regulations, policies, procedures, and other standards such as CPT coding guidelines and CMS policies. Assists in preparing annual audit and work plan. Performs work outlined in work plan. Obtains and analyzes data. Identifies and evaluates the area under review, identifying and documenting areas of risk and vulnerability related to non-compliance. Assists in development of new policies and procedures and audit tools. Performs E/M and Procedural coding audits. Analyzes audit findings and reports/tracks results for one-on-one or group feedback. Provides one-on-one or group education. Performs billing audits and ensures correct coding and billing compliance. Assists with RAC audits and review of other outside requests as directed. Documents audit work and findings in accordance with department standards. During the audit and monitoring process, identifies and analyzes areas weaknesses, research causes, and formulate recommendations back to the appropriate department. Provides communication of audit findings to department leadership as directed by management. The auditor should be familiar with basic clinical documentation and charge capture methodologies.
2. Customer Service - Provides courtesy and friendly service. Develops productive working relationships with all levels of management, staff and providers. Identifies and seeks resolution to barriers. Demonstrates customer service qualities that instill confidence. Mentors others on how to provide the highest level of customer service. Effectively follows up and closes all issues assigned or identifies issues to management with recommendations on how to proceed. Conducts and/or facilitates meetings where information is shared with operational departments concerning new regulations, billing and other compliance activities or other standards. Assists with the development and delivery of appropriate compliance training and education across the UNC Health Care System. Serves as a resource to physicians, coders and reimbursement analysts. Responds to inquiries on how best to code, document and bill for that impact professional compliance. Communicates openly and effectively with team members and management.
3. Investigations ? Investigates, questions, gathers data, integrates and interprets data with the intent to report information and provide an analysis and recommendation of findings. Familiarizes self with area under review. Researches and gathers all relevant materials including but not limited to regulations, policies, and procedures, coding guidelines, and CMS rules regulations. Conducts interviews understanding operational workflows in order to thoroughly assess compliance issues and risk. Performs data collection and analysis. Documents findings in accordance with department standards, communicates findings as directed by management and provides an analysis of findings with recommendations. Works with departmental leaders on corrective action plans.
4. Professional Development - Maintains current knowledge of CPT and ICD coding guidelines as well as CMS policy and regulations. Reads trade journals articles related to coding and compliance and shares knowledge with peers and customers.
5. Special Projects - Performs special projects as requested by management as needed or assigned.


Other Information
Other information:
Education Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business Administration, Health Administration, Nursing or related field (or equivalent combination of education, training and experience).
Licensure/Certification Requirements:

Coding certification (e.g., CPC, CCS-P) within eighteen (18) months from date of hire.
Professional Experience Requirements:

If a Bachelor's degree: No prior experience required.
If an Associate's degree: Four (4) years of relevant experience.
If a High School diploma or GED: Eight (8) years of relevant experience.
Knowledge/Skills/and Abilities Requirements:

Basic to Intermediate and demonstrated ability to research regulations and understand professional billing and reimbursement methodologies. Must maintain current knowledge of governmental policies such as local and national coverage decisions and CMS rules and regulations. Intermediate knowledge of clinical documentation, coding and billing. Must be familiar with reference sources and have the ability to navigate and link various sources of regulations and standards. Must be able to interpret billing compliance and other regulations and apply them to specific situations or scenarios. Basic to Intermediate understanding and demonstrated ability of clinical and revenue cycle operations. Must demonstrate an understanding of the operating environment and how these operations and the demands of productivity interface with regulatory requirements. Basic to Intermediate knowledge of the Professional Compliance Program requirements. Ability to gather evidence, analyzes data, and develops recommendations. Intermediate level of knowledge, skills and abilities with regard to listening, communicating and presenting materials. Demonstrates and teaches professional compliance and billing and coding compliance to others. Intermediate Microsoft Application Proficiency with the ability to use graphs, pivot tables, and formulas. Ability to create Visio flow charts. Intermediate proficiency with applications required for area of expertise, data extraction and data analysis. Intermediate data analysis and critical thinking skills. Ability to organize, analyze and interpret data and evidence, communicate findings and make recommendations. Intermediate to Advanced research skills and consistently demonstrates going above and beyond to find solutions. Requires excellent verbal and written communication skills. Clearly express thoughts and ideas and must possess the ability to effectively transfer knowledge to others. Must be able to interview staff to understand operational processes and areas of concern. Written communication is clear, concise and professional. Must have Intermediate to advanced presentation skills with the ability to present findings and answer questions. Ability to translate technical coding, billing, and regulatory information and knowledge to non-technical users. Advanced organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and multiple deadlines in a positive manner. Basic ability to advise management and departmental stakeholders on compliance issues and risk. Must have advanced ability to listen carefully and follow directions. Asks for clarification and seeks guidance when needed. Prefer knowledge of CPT, ICD 9 and ICD 10 coding. Prefer health care business knowledge and knowledge of anatomy, physiology, medical terminology and reimbursement methodologies. Serves as a support resource to physicians and others, provides exceptional customer service. Advanced ability to work with well others and conduct work in respectful manner. Communicates clearly and positively in all forms of communication, demonstrates team work and follows the normal business protocol. Demonstrates a positive attitude. Maintains appropriate professional conduct, appearance and language. Is tactful and respectful in communication. Ability to lead others and serve as a mentor to peers.

Job Description Summary
The primary purpose of this position is to support and enable the Lowe’s Salesforce Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platform. The Lowe’s Salesforce CRM platform is used to drive and streamline sales operations for Pro Sales teams, enable growth, daily execution, drive customer engagement, and provide valuable business and customer analytics and insights. This role will be working with leadership, sales teams, and a large group of cross-functional partners focusing on large data sets and functionality needs, along with driving towards simple, scalable solutions to difficult problems to improve internal operations and the selling experience of the sales teams.

Key Responsibilities

Gathers quantitative and qualitative feedback from within various platforms and from end users
Helps identify and drive continuous improvement of current business processes as a result of the downstream effect of broader company initiatives, systems changes, ideation efforts, efficiencies, etc.
May analyze pro customers’ and sales team habits and tendencies, in order to maintain and enhance new programs and processes that will attract profitable Pro business
Creates and analyzes key reports
Provides necessary support across the ProServices organization to maximize all sales and growth opportunities for pro sales
Maintains/updates data and file storage integrity in platforms via organizational best practices
Recognizes and resolves technology defects
Creates a collaborative environment by working in a team of peers to solve problems and shares information with peers, manager, sales teams, and customers as appropriate
Creates innovative and informative training and educational materials, including PowerPoint presentations and documents to educate Lowe’s associates of all levels on relevant topics
Influences key stakeholders without authority
Communicates to end users and leadership regularly
Stays connected with the needs of the business and the sales organization
Maintains transparency of availability
Quickly adapts to market and business changes
Works cross-functionally across the Lowe's enterprise

Required Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in business, marketing, mathematics, statistics, or the equivalent analytical background , or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
5+ years of experience working cross-functionally with multiple groups and/or across an enterprise
Ability to work successfully in a remote manner
5+ years of experience with remote interfacing tools such as Zoom, Google Meet or Microsoft Teams or a willingness to learn and leverage these tools
Ability to work with a high degree of autonomy
Willingness to travel for specific training or tradeshow events

Preferred Experience

Experience in Home Improvement or Industrial/Commercial Supply House very helpful, with experience at Lowe’s or another mass retailer
Experience working with Salesforce CRM or other similar platforms

About Lowe’s

Lowe's Companies, Inc. (NYSE: LOW) is a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company serving approximately 17 million customer transactions a week in the U.S. With total fiscal year 2022 sales of over $97 billion, approximately $92 billion of sales were generated in the U.S., where Lowe's operates over 1,700 home improvement stores and employs approximately 300,000 associates. Based in Mooresville, N.C., Lowe's supports the communities it serves through programs focused on creating safe, affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts. For more information, visit Lowes.com.

Pay Range for CA, CO, NJ, NY, WA: $68,400.00 - $114,000.00 annually

Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit our benefits page.

Job Description

The Digital Optimization Analyst will analyze data to provide insights for optimizing our digital channels, driving business, and enhancing the guest experience. This position monitors and analyzes website and app traffic and survey responses from all marketing sources. They use data to understand consumer behavior, optimize conversion funnels, and increase conversion rates. This position will work closely with the UI/UX Designer to recommend and help implement A/B testing.

This position is also responsible for the coordination of analytics projects between internal and external partners. The Digital Optimization Analyst will have a holistic understanding of digital data structure and manage analytics implementations and change requests; working closely with the Corporate Technology teams. This position suggests improvements for greater effectiveness and performance of Biltmore's digital infrastructure. Additionally, this position will keep informed of data privacy regulations and ensure our tracking is in compliance.

Essential Job Duties:

1. Identify trends in abandonment, high converting pages and/or products, paths, population groups, etc. and make recommendations for site enhancements.
2. Provide Marketing Managers online analytic insights to optimize business decisions.
3. Measure, analyze, and report on weekly and monthly key performance indicators for web & app content using Google Analytics and other data sources.
4. Prepare summary reports and presentations of findings for distribution to Marketing Managers and senior management.
5. Develop an ongoing strategic plan for optimization testing to increase conversion and revenue.
6. Coordinate and analyze A/B tests and surveys for web and app content.
7. Monitor content through online analytics to ensure it is tagged correctly.
8. Manage changes and enhancements to analytics, evaluating platform, suggesting updates, and coordinating all testing.
9. Update data collection processes as necessary to stay in compliance with privacy regulations.

Additional Responsibilities:

1. Stay informed of industry changes and help drive innovation
2. Oversee the effectiveness of relationships with Google and other associated partners
3. Provide testing and other support for the CRM as needed.
4. Provide general assistance and support for the marketing department and the company.
5. May represent the department on project teams, committees, etc., as assigned.

Qualifications:

1. A two- or four-year degree in Marketing, Business, or other related field. Additional education or training preferred. Ideal candidate will have four-year degree.
2. A minimum of four (4) years of experience with website analytics or data analysis. Equivalent combination of education/experience considered. Preferred candidate will have previous experience working in an agency or other corporate setting.
3. Demonstrated commitment to delivery of world class internal/external guest service.
4. Proficient in MS Office, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, A/B testing and web research software, reporting and database tools.
5. Experience with WordPress and Magento preferred, HTML/CSS knowledge a plus.
6. Knowledge of website usability best practices, SEO, W3C standards, and browser compatibility issues.
7. Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills; conveys information clearly/concisely; builds positive relationships at all levels; strong presentation skills.
8. Excellent planning, project/time management skills; prioritizes work, adapts.
9. Proactive, exercises good judgment; problem solves; focus on quality/service.
10. Collaborative; troubleshoots; works professionally in corporate environment.

Physical Requirements:

1. Works primarily in an office setting.
2. May lift up to 15 pounds occasionally.

Job Title: Data Scientist I or II - PAZE Strategy Analyst
Job Description:
The position is described below. If you want to apply, click the Apply Now button at the top or bottom of this page. Regular

1st shift (United States of America)

Please review the following job description:

Job Profile Summary
Perform sophisticated analytics (statistical and predictive analytics, machine learning modeling, etc.) to provide actionable insights that improve business outcomes and minimize risk and also provide consultation to business leaders and other stakeholders on how to leverage analytics insights and build strategies around analytics.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.


1. Independently perform sophisticated data analytics (ranging from classical econometrics to machine learning, neural networks, and natural language processing) in a variety of environments using structured and unstructured data.
2. Produce compelling data visualizations to communicate insights and influence outcomes among a wide array of stakeholders.
3. Take accountability and ownership of end-to-end data science solution design, technical delivery, and measurable business outcome.
4. Engage in stakeholder meetings to identify business objectives and scope solution requirements.
5. With minimal guidance, write, document, and deploy custom code in a variety of environments (Python, SAS, R, etc.) to create predictive analytics applications.
6. Use, maintain, share and collaborate through Truist internal code repositories to foster continual learning and cross-pollination of skillsets.
7. Actively research and advocate adoption of emerging methods and technologies in the data science field, with the eye of continually advancing Truist’s capabilities.
8. Exercise sound judgment and fosters risk management culture throughout design, development, and deployment practices; partner with cross-functional teams to coordinate rules on data usage, data governance and analytics capabilities.

Responsibilities specific to PAZE wallet -

Build Fraud strategies/Authorization rules for PAZE

Identify and work with technology partners to get more data attributes

Potentially build some rules or indicators in EWS system

Build out analytics and reporting processes

Attending project calls with other banks to framework what data we’ll get, use and decision on.

Assisting with claims mapping or data questions as needed


Level I:

QUALIFICATIONS
Required Qualifications:
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
1. Bachelor’s degree and zero to four or more years of experience in a quantitative field such as Finance, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, or Engineering, or equivalent education and related training
2. Exhibit understanding of statistical methods, including a broad understanding of classical statistics, probability theory, econometrics, time-series, and primary statistical tests
3. Familiarity with linear algebra concepts for optimization, complex matrix operations, eigenvalue decompositions, and principal components; working knowledge of calculus/differential equations, with understanding of stochastic processes
4. Demonstrate understanding of data cleansing and preparation methodologies, including regex, filtering, indexing, interpolation, and outlier treatment
5. Strong familiarity with data extraction in a variety of environments (SQL, JQuery, etc.)
6. Working knowledge of Hadoop, Pig, Hive, and/or NoSQL, Spark
7. Experience in managing multiple projects with tight deadlines in a collaborative environment

Preferred Qualifications:
1. Master’s degree or PhD in a quantitative field such as Finance, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, or Engineering
2. Four years of relevant work experience if candidate lacks graduate degree
3. Previous experience in the banking or fin-tech industry

Level II:
QUALIFICATIONS
Required Qualifications:
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
1. Bachelor’s degree and four or more years of experience in a quantitative field such as Finance, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, or Engineering, or equivalent education and related training
2. Exhibit understanding of statistical methods, including a broad understanding of classical statistics, probability theory, econometrics, time-series, and primary statistical tests
3. Familiarity with linear algebra concepts for optimization, complex matrix operations, eigenvalue decompositions, and principal components; working knowledge of calculus/differential equations, with understanding of stochastic processes
4. Demonstrate understanding of data cleansing and preparation methodologies, including regex, filtering, indexing, interpolation, and outlier treatment
5. Strong familiarity with data extraction in a variety of environments (SQL, JQuery, etc.)
6. Working knowledge of Hadoop, Pig, Hive, and/or NoSQL, Spark
7. Experience in managing multiple projects with tight deadlines in a collaborative environment

Preferred Qualifications:
1. Master’s degree or PhD in a quantitative field such as Finance, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, or Engineering
2. Four years of relevant work experience if candidate lacks graduate degree
3. Previous experience in the banking or fin-tech industry

Quanta Technology is an independent technology, consulting, and testing company providing business and technical expertise, along with advanced methodologies and processes, to utilities and others in the power and energy industries. Our mission is to provide unparalleled value to our clients in every engagement across the value chain by using advanced software and hardware, laboratories, and custom tools for a holistic approach to practical service and the most insightful thought leadership in the industry.

At Quanta Technology, our people define us. We value a company culture based on core values of diversity, teamwork, respect, accountability, innovation, and entrepreneurial spirit. Not only will you get the chance to work alongside industry thought leaders, but the opportunity to become a thought leader yourself. We’re focused on creating an environment committed to employee growth. That is achieved by ensuring a quality workspace, allowing flexible schedules, and through our training and mentoring programs. Quanta Technology is committed to an equal-opportunity workplace.

POSITION OVERVIEW

The Sr Business Analyst’s responsibilities include extensive knowledge of financial planning, forecasting, and budgeting, as well as having a clear understanding of how to prepare internal and external reports including key performance indicators and summaries of work execution progress. The analyst will also work with a line of business leaders in preparing business cases for project approval.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop innovative solutions for operational and strategic changes
Provide financial analysis on portfolio cost variances for plan vs. actual
Work with colleagues and stakeholders to gain an in-depth understanding of critical business requirements
Analyze data models to deliver logical conclusions
Create processes or systems needed to implement changes
Interact with senior-level management regarding the implementation of changes
Evaluate implications of changes
Write reports and create presentations to highlight the effect of changes you made
Analyze documents, data, user surveys, and workflows, which will deliver problem-solving solutions. Analyze key metrics data to help leaders make informed business decisions.
Interpret and translate the needs of customers into operational processes.
Responsible for all phases of a project lifecycle

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

TRAVEL

This is a remote position; however, travel may be required on occasion based on client assignments.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or another related discipline
Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience

SKILLS

Strong interpersonal skills
Excellent communicator with the ability to translate data into actionable insights
Superior analytical abilities
Decision-making capabilities for assessing inputs from stakeholders, analyzing a situation, and selecting successful plans of action
High-level project management capabilities as this is an interdisciplinary role
Python or a similar programming language
Microsoft Office applications
Expert-level Excel and PowerPoint skills
Proficient in Office, Project, and Visio
Ability to work in a diverse and inclusive space.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

6+ years of relevant work experience
Programming and/or certifications involving working with large data models

SKILLS

Power BI reporting and migrating competency
OPPM and other Oracle systems, Primavera, and Microsoft project data competence

LOCATION

Quanta Technology has offices in Raleigh, NC, Markham, ON, Lombard, IL, and San Clemente, CA. We offer remote and hybrid employment that supports a blend of in-office and remote work.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Working conditions are normal for a professional office environment. Work may require overnight national and international travel.

Job Title: Risk Information Technology and Data Analyst
Job Description:
Thank you for your interest in a career at Regions. At Regions, we believe associates deserve more than just a job. We believe in offering performance-driven individuals a place where they can build a career --- a place to expect more opportunities. If you are focused on results, dedicated to quality, strength and integrity, and possess the drive to succeed, then we are your employer of choice.

Regions is dedicated to taking appropriate steps to safeguard and protect private and personally identifiable information you submit. The information that you submit will be collected and reviewed by associates, consultants, and vendors of Regions in order to evaluate your qualifications and experience for job opportunities and will not be used for marketing purposes, sold, or shared outside of Regions unless required by law. Such information will be stored in accordance with regulatory requirements and in conjunction with Regions’ Retention Schedule for a minimum of three years. You may review, modify, or update your information by visiting and logging into the careers section of the system.

Job Description:
At Regions, the Risk Information Technology and Data Analyst is a key member of the Innovation and IT and Data Risk Management organization and performs activities consistent with the second line of defense. This position will influence enterprise innovation and conduct IT and Data risk identification, measurement, mitigation, monitoring, and reporting activities in accordance with the enterprise strategy and enterprise risk appetite.

Primary Responsibilities
Assists in conducting key tasks and/or projects to perform IT and Data Risk Assessments, Advisory Reviews, Project Assessments, 3rd Party Testing, and other project reviews as identified across all aspects of Information Technology and Data, including application development, cyber security, enterprise architecture, business continuity and disaster recovery, data governance, data quality, and change management, etc.
Remains abreast of innovative business and technology trends in IT and Data security, risk, security, and controls and advise leadership on technology and data initiatives that support these trends
Manages relationships with key stakeholders within strategic business groups and technology to ensure effective execution of the risk management framework
Performs deep dives on IT and Data security-related processes and systems
Identifies applicable regulatory risks from changes or releases to regulatory guidance and requirements and provide subject matter expertise for resolution and risk mitigation
Manages targeted reviews of internal risk and control assessments on current and/or emerging IT and Data risks
Develops, tracks, and reports on Key Risk Indicators (KRI’s) for Information Technology
Monitors, tracks, and reports mitigation and resolution of IT and Data risk issues
Develops and manages reporting to effectively communicate key risks, findings, and recommendations for improvement and discuss results with key stakeholders

This position is exempt from timekeeping requirements under the Fair Labor Standards Act and is not eligible for overtime pay.

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in related field
Six (6) years of experience in IT, system development, information security and/or data governance/quality
Understanding of risk management functions, including IT and audit, cyber security, and compliance

Preferences
Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)
Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC)
Experience in a financial institution or public accounting
Knowledge of third-party/vendor management lifecycle

Skills and Competencies
Ability to learn additional systems as needed
Ability to research, analyze data, and derive facts
Ability to work in a team environment when applicable
Ability to work under moderate guidance
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.)
Strong verbal, written communication, and organizational skills
Strong work ethic and self-motivation

Position Type Full time

As an Analyst, IT Business at United Rentals, you will be responsible for assisting with the facilitation and integration of business processes within a fast paced technology environment. You’ll interact with the business stakeholders and subject matter experts in order to understand their problems and needs. You’ll solve business problems and, as needed, design technical solutions. You will also evaluate and test new or modified software programs and software development procedures used to verify that programs function according to user requirements and conform to establishment guidelines

If you would enjoy the chance to make your mark with the world’s largest equipment rental provider, consider a future with United Rentals. We'll provide the tools, the technology and the support you need to do the job right. You will also be supported by a strong management team that will help you achieve your goals.

**This role may be contract-to-hire or direct

Additional duties include the following:

Manage on-going expansion and IT improvement processes for assigned businesses

Accountable for providing leadership and independent initiatives in facilitating and conducting in-formation gathering structured documentation and presentation of findings

Liaise with internal customers and IT departments and follow up to completion on various programming and IT issues

Maintain current project notes and communicate information to business partners and developers

Work independently and collaboratively with developers in troubleshooting system failures and data discrepancies

Administer user acceptance testing for all new software developed providing final approval for project to be moved into production

Support internal and external Help Desk resources with unresolved questions from application users

Responsible for accurate and detailed SDLC documentation including functional requirements, test plans and test scripts

Perform ongoing documentation of enhancements to applications

Other duties assigned as needed

Job Requirements:

Bachelors degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required

4+ years in Business Analyst or related role.

Solid working knowledge of mobile, ERP and Logistics systems and technologies

Analytically oriented with strong documentation skills

Strong interpersonal skills to interact with clients daily

Experienced in relational database analysis with strong data query skills

Experienced with Word, PowerPoint, Adobe, Excel

Ability to distill information and articulate business needs to developers

Understanding of relationships between theoretical information and data

Why join us?

We don’t just “talk the talk!” We’re an award-winning company (recently named a Glassdoor Best Place to Work in 2023) that truly cares about our people - That’s why we offer best-in-class benefits and perks that will support you and your family.
